Title: Data Analyst
Description:
üöÄ Welcome to Maltem Belgium: Your IT Playground!

Established in 2004, Maltem Belgium is proud of being a human-sized agency, prioritizing strong connections with our consultants. We provide an environment where both personal and professional growth are encouraged, within a healthy and dynamic atmosphere.




üíº Join the Adventure:

Your career here is more than just a job, it's a journey filled with transparency, unwavering support, and limitless chances for personal and professional fulfillment.




üåü Why Choose Maltem Consulting:

At Maltem Consulting Group, our reach extends across 12 countries and includes a team of 1200 co-workers, forming a diverse ecosystem. As a part of our global community, you'll experience more than just stability, you'll become part of an incredibly supportive network.

Get ready for a human adventure filled with meaningful connections. ü§ù




‚û§ Job Description




Collect, sort out and interpret data.
Identify patterns and trends in data sets.
Deliver large and complex Advanced Analytics Programmes and set and optimise the delivery frameworks to drive efficiencies.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders throughout the program / project life cycle with the aim of building relationships, ensuring efficiencies, and delivering project outcomes
Provide support to stakeholders on emerging projects, market segmentation analysis and identifying new customer segments for campaign implementation.




üìçLocated in Brussels

üè† 50% Work Remotely

üìù Freelance or permanent contract




‚û§ Profile




5 years of relevant experience in data management and data analysis,
Good understanding of the principles, key controls and processes relating to data management as well as data modelling and data integration.
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion
Experience working with business intelligence/data visualization tool using Tableau, PowerBI.
Be curious and proactive with a strong collaborative mind.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in IT or a related field
Immediate availability
Fluent in French, English, and Dutch




‚û§ Benefits




Company‚Äôs and hospital Insurance

Eco-Vouchers
Mobility budget / company car and fuel budget

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ACENSI BELGIUM is looking for his client a Data Analyst (F/M)




Expanding steadily since its launch in 2003, the ACENSI group is an IT consultancy firm, well known for their technical and functional know-how, who specialize in Telecommunications, Media and Financial Markets, as well as in the Energy industry.




ACENSI guides businesses in evolutionary IT projects from the initial strategies through to their realization (Management and Project management, Development, Design and Implementation, Infrastructure). From its original focus on technical engineering and Business Analysis, ACENSI has developed new areas of expertise in Human Resource Management Systems, Business Intelligence, e-learning and Client Relationship Management.




Dynamism, enthusiasm and social development are all valued at ACENSI, allowing our clients to benefit from consultants with a true blend of talents.







Context of the mission / Objective(s) of the job

The client is looking to reinforce the knowledge and application of data analytics to obtain insights within the financial market and to make data driven decisions.

The client wants to extend the expertise and maturity of the internal data science team in the usage of analytic models for enhancing data into insight transitioning, and for evolving toward holistic data driven decision processes. Title: BI/Data Analyst
Description:
DexMach is a fast-growing organization with innovative cloud automation solutions. We operate as the Cloud Center of Excellence for the Cegeka Group and are recognized as one (of the only 3) Azure Expert MSP in Belgium. Are you ready to skyrocket your career in the cloud? Join our team as BI/Data Analyst and enjoy a rewarding career in a scale-up with the perks of a large company.¬†¬†




Key overall responsibility is to work with the customer business teams and apply your statistical, analytical and visualization skills. This typically includes the following activities:

¬†

Create a trustful relationship with our customers and assist in their data needs
Act as the link between the technical and business roles, translate the information requirements into functional specifications, ensuring all essential data analysis functionalities are embedded
Translate source data and business requirements into conceptual and logical data models that are fit for purpose
Support your business colleagues to increase their self-service insights capabilities via¬†creating intuitive and impactful visualizations.
Create dashboards that are not only pleasing to the eye but also convey accurate and actionable insights effectively
Implement data validation and data quality checks
Commitment to continuous improvement and staying updated with the latest trends and techniques in data visualization.

¬†

¬†

What you need to succeed:

¬†

A natural-born problem solver who takes initiative and is eager to learn
At least 2 years of experience in Power Bi (Power Query, DAX, Power Bi Service)
Strong focus on the visual aspects of dashboards, ensuring clarity, coherence, and aesthetic appeal.
Understanding of best practices in data visualization and design principles.
Strong communication skills, especially to explain complex analytical problems in a clear, precise and actionable manner
Good understanding of data warehousing, data modeling, and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with unstructured data and handling various data formats (JSON, CSV, Parquet)
Proficiency in working with APIs to extract and manipulate data
High level of accuracy and attention to detail in data analysis and reporting.
Flexible, collaborative and results driven mindset: enthusiastic to work in a very dynamic & changing environment, committed and business savvy to navigate the potential technical or organizational roadblocks
Team spirit.¬†Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, teach others and learn from your teammates.
Experience in working in an agile organization is a plus
Experience in working in Azure is a plus (e.g. Azure Data Factory, Fabric)
Fluent in English. Knowledge of Dutch is a plus
You must be authorized and eligible to work freely in the EU

¬†




What are we offering:




DexMach is a fast-growing organization with innovative cloud automation solutions. We are one of the few Microsoft Azure Expert MSP worldwide and proud winner of the Belgium Microsoft Partner of the Year 2021 award. According to our employees, we are a FUN company: your happiness is our concern. Team spirit is key to success, we are #oneteam!
Together with all that we offer you a market-tailored salary package, including extra-legal advantages.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst

Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions.¬†

International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)
+ 450 employees
over 20% growth each year

¬†

Performs cleansing of data quality issues through the analysi

Will be involved in all the topics related to Customer Data
Business Analysis

Data extraction with SAS
Industrialize the process to run define periodicity
Document the project (functional and technical part)

At least 3 years¬†of experience in Data Analysis (focus data quality & data governance)
Understand data lifecycle and data usage

Good experience working with SQL Queries & SAS
English Fluent & French or Dutch native

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
afarax is looking for a freelance Data Analyst. We need you!







The project:

Our client in the financial sector is looking for a Data Analyst to join their team.

Tasks:

Stabilise the data structure in order to fasten client and project study
Contribute to Strategic board to monitor Cash Management activities in line with Exco expectation and regulatory requirements
Support and stream, for the Customer Care head, some client initiatives and programs, to improve the Corporate Customer Journey linked to compliance subjects. To contribute to a series of identified initiatives (process, tools, robotization, policies, etc.) aiming to improve the flow filtering process without increasing the risk from a bank point of view.
Help the project owner to develop a strong link between the Business and Compliance stakeholders to ensure current and future policies are implemented to minimize business and operational hurdles
Contribute to relevant communications towards the Cash Management community on Compliance & Regulatory topics
Product support: liaise with the client during onboading, product introduction, GO live and day to day support







Is this you?

Strong written and spoken communication skills in English and French
Dutch is optional
Data analyst ‚Äì ability to translate into business needs identification and client solution deliveries
Defining and analyzing business model using conceptual modeling techniques and methods
Acting as the interface between the project owner and functions/business
Risk, quality and issue management
Requirements management and communication and ensure good understanding of business‚Äô needs
Liaison between all stakeholders & guarantee customer satisfaction
Support in change management
Part in the delivery of effective solutions to complex business challenges
Agile Backlog Management
IT and architecture environment
Experience with Cash Management is highly recommended
Experience with conceptual modeling techniques and methods; data management tools Tableau, Access, Python.
Good expertise in MS Office and Excel
Good understanding of work flow processes
Able to initiate a priority management approach, ensure the product consistency and quality
Able to conduct Sprints Backlog live adjustments and follow-up
Lead the release note to communicate changes to internal and external users
Project Management







How afarax supports you?

You benefit from our extensive network
You will have access to projects that fit your expertise
We help and support you throughout your project
We offer the possibility to build a valuable and lasting partnership

Check out more projects on: https://afarax.be/jobs/type/freelance/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a pivotal member of our Finance team, you will harness the power of data to transform complex financial information into clear, actionable insights that propel our organization forward. They will serve as the linchpin in bridging the theoretical frameworks and practical applications of data governance, ensuring robust and compliant data practices. Collaborating closely with our agile Scrum teams, they will spearhead the development and implementation of cutting-edge AI and BI use cases, driving innovation and enhancing our data-driven decision-making capabilities.

Detailled tasks


Convert the theoretical data governance framework of data owners, data stewards and data custodians into a data culture where Finance employees are empowered by their data governance responsibilities and experiences.
Encourage and support experimentation and innovation in data practices, aligning with the organization's mission for sustainability and operational excellence.
Extract and interpret financial data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform strategic decisions.
Work closely with the Scrum teams to integrate AI and BI solutions into business processes and workflows.
Provide training and support to team members on data analysis tools and methodologies.
Identify opportunities for leveraging AI and BI to improve financial processes and outcome in line with our company wide AI program.
Monitor and ensure data quality within the department.
Advocate for data stewardship and encourage proactive data management.
Facilitate effective communication and collaboration between business units and their respective data stewards.
Actively work to improve data management KPIs within the department by ensuring all data-related activities are executed effectively and efficiently.
Work transversally across departments to identify and address data silos.


Profile

A degree in Finance, economics, computer science, data science, or a related field.

Competences:


Ability to think strategically and align data initiatives with organizational goals and objectives
Proficiency in transforming complex datasets into actionable insights and familiarity with statistical analysis tools and methodologies
Strong knowledge of data governance principles and practices, including data quality, and data management requirements
Experience in developing and implementing AI and BI solutions, with an understanding of Machine Learning algorithms and Business Intelligence platforms
Good communication and presentation skills
Ability to influence and drive change within the department
Familiarity with Scrum and agile methodologies, and the ability to work effectively within cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
Proficiency with data analysis and visualization tools, such as SQL, Python, R, Tableau, or Power BI
Excellent collaborative skills and ability to maintain positive work relationships
A commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with the latest trends and technologies in data analysis and governance


Knowledge:


Understanding of (financial) data analysis and its application in driving strategic business decisions.
Familiarity with data governance principles and the ability to bridge theory and practice.
Knowledge of AI and BI tools and methodologies for developing use cases and solutions.
Awareness of agile and Scrum methodologies, particularly in the context of cross-functional team collaboration.


Experience


Experience in transforming (Finance) data into actionable insights.
Practical experience with data governance and ensuring data compliance within an organization.
Hands-on experience in facilitating and developing AI and BI use cases.
Proven track record of working closely with Scrum teams to deliver data-driven projects
Show more

Title: Data Analyst / BI Analyst / Business Intelligence
Description:
My client is a leading Utilities organisation in the centre of Brussels searching for a strong Data/Business Intelligence Analyst on an initial 12 month contract with plenty of scope for extension.

Key Skills


Microsoft Excel
Power BI - Must have skill
Minimum 3-5 Years experience
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Dutch speaking - Bonus (not a necessity)
1-2 Days onsite per week, rest remote


Key responsibilities

Performance Analysis:


Monitor the correct execution of the day-to-day commercial processes and proactively identify and react on potential problems.
Conduct in-depth analysis of the companys commercial performance metrics (e.g. value capture, revenue per product, customer bidding behaviour,...).
Identify areas for improvement and provide actionable insights that could lead to enhanced commercial performance.
Perform competitive benchmarking.
Validate monthly Sales invoices.


Financial Modelling:


Develop and maintain financial models to support revenue forecasting, budgeting, and scenario analysis.
Provide financial insights to support commercial negotiations and decision-making related to auction strategy, new products, ancillary service tenders...).


Reporting and Data Warehouse:


Prepare and deliver regular reports on commercial performance and relevant market information to internal stakeholders (e.g. Management Committee, Board of Directors...).
Deliver the recurring external reports (e.g. imbalance reporting)
Provide Finance with the monthly revenue forecasts.
Provide ad-hoc reporting on the results of important auctions.

Title: Data Analyst (freelance)
Company: Templeton & Partners - Innovative & Inclusive Hiring Solutions
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst/Data Engineer to join our client's team for a new freelance project. Your expertise will support the business in creating and documenting reports and dashboards across various domains.




Responsibilities:




Understand and translate business needs into clear requirements.
Identify required data and data sources for extractions and reporting.
Collect, integrate, and transform data securely.
Create reports and analyses for internal customers and regulatory purposes.
Document data collection and transformation processes.
Build reports using Salesforce, and dashboards using Tableau or Power BI.
Ensure data quality and security.
Discover trends and insights.
Document data integrations and reports.

Fluent in Dutch or French, and English.
4+ years of experience as a data engineer.
Strong IT background in data modeling, documentation, collection, transformation, GDPR/data protection, and building data structures.
Experience in BI, developing dashboards, and structured data delivery.
Proficiency in Excel, Salesforce reporting/analytic studio, and Tableau.
Knowledge of UML and Scrum.
Experience with ETL/ELT tools is a plus.

Duration: 6 months to begin with, with potential extension.

HTML:
We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst/Data Engineer to join our client's team for a new freelance project. Your expertise will support the business in creating and documenting reports and dashboards across various domains.


Responsibilities:


  • Understand and translate business needs into clear requirements.
  • Identify required data and data sources for extractions and reporting.
  • Collect, integrate, and transform data securely.
  • Create reports and analyses for internal customers and regulatory purposes.
  • Document data collection and transformation processes.
  • Build reports using Salesforce, and dashboards using Tableau or Power BI.
  • Ensure data quality and security.
  • Discover trends and insights.
  • Document data integrations and reports.


Requirements:


  • Fluent in Dutch or French, and English.
  • 4+ years of experience as a data engineer.
  • Strong IT background in data modeling, documentation, collection, transformation, GDPR/data protection, and building data structures.
  • Experience in BI, developing dashboards, and structured data delivery.
  • Proficiency in Excel, Salesforce reporting/analytic studio, and Tableau.
  • Knowledge of UML and Scrum.
  • Experience with ETL/ELT tools is a plus.


Project Information:


  • Duration: 6 months to begin with, with potential extension.
  • Working style: Hybrid.
  • Work location: Brussels.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Passionate people create exceptional things

Did you know that the solutions we develop are a key part of most industries? We¬¥re everywhere! Working with us means that you can make an impact towards a sustainable future.
Here, your ideas are embraced, you never stop learning, and you can be part of the solution for a better tomorrow.

Join us and make the difference

Your Role

The Smart Compressors team in Engineering in Industrial Air enables (remote) control and monitoring, collects insights into the machines and allows them to communicate with its environment, all to turn it into a state-of-the-art smart compressor.
As a member of this team in Engineering in Industrial Air, you will collaborate globally to maximize and expand the potential of data in machines.
You implement, help and (once fully trained) coordinate data-driven tasks for our compressors.
You explore machine data and gain new insights, and you develop new processes that ensure that data provides better visibility into the performance of our current and future compressors.
There will be a wide variety of data tasks in terms of complexity, timeline, and overall data set size.
The goal is to implement your findings into tangible business value, such as: proactively guaranteeing machine uptime, and using data to pitch new functionalities that make our smart compressor even smarter.
You will work within engineering, a diverse group of experts and project engineers, who work together in a family-like atmosphere. You are encouraged to develop yourself, provide valuable input and receive a godmother/-father to help you on your way. You participate in projects that impact our business and ensure the sustainability of our planet.

To succeed, you will need


You have a Master's degree in Computer Science, Data engineering or similar through experience.
You enjoy working with data and have a passion for technology.
You find it important to work with different people and you feel good in a team.
You dare to build new methods and want to improve processes.
You can program with Python, SQL and are familiar with Azure.
You can visualize data with Power BI, or are willing to learn this.
You speak English, Dutch is an added value.
MS Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Word) and other O365 applications have no secrets for you.
You are interested in artificial intelligence and machine learning.



In return, we offer you


A supportive working environment, within a high performing team.
A satisfying career ‚Äì We are passionate about the development & progression of our employees.



Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice

Bright ideas come from all of us. We recognize that our long-term success depends on how we behave towards our colleagues, business partners, society and the planet.
Together we build a culture where difference is valued, we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging, and we can be part of the solution for a better tomorrow.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
How we work


You will have autonomy and ownership of all data analytics for your area of the business. Working cross-functionally, with product managers, data engineers, and stakeholder teams, you will create, manage and grow your data domain and business intelligence infrastructure. From building product analytics dashboards to deep-diving into our users‚Äô data and driving the strategic direction of the product, you‚Äôll be at the forefront of Atom‚Äôs innovation engine. You will also be part of the Analytics Guild which is where data engineers, analysts and analytics engineers from across the business maintain a centralised roadmap for core projects.


Atom Learning‚Äôs mission is to make education fairer and you will work within a flat, decentralised management environment on a product that is changing the way children learn across the world, improving education standards for all.


What you will do

  • Collaborate with a number of teams to gain a deep understanding of their data requirements and business objectives;
  • Work closely with the data engineers and analytics engineers in your business area to develop and maintain robust and consistent data models to power reporting, self-serve analysis, and deeper strategic analysis;
  • Conduct regular self-directed analysis that will guide and support your area of the business in identifying opportunity areas and making key strategic decisions;
  • Present your findings and recommendations to key stakeholders effectively;
  • Build and maintain dashboards and other data products that support your business function(s) with decision making on a day-to-day basis;
  • Monitor your business function‚Äôs KPIs, and identify drivers of under and over-performance. Communicate this effectively to the relevant teams to support them in optimising performance;
  • Support your team with designing, implementing and interpreting the results of A/B tests;
  • You will influence the overall direction of data in your business area and have an opportunity to shape the future of the product.


Who you are

  • You are passionate about data and its role in solving business challenges;
  • You are proficient in SQL;
  • You are proficient in data visualisation tools such as Tableau;
  • You are a great communicator and have excellent data storytelling skills;
  • You can write clear, readable code;
  • You can create reusable solutions to fulfil a brief and support future changes;
  • You are a highly motivated contributor with excellent teamwork skills;
  • You are enthusiastic about working in a rapidly growing start-up environment which focuses on creating a culture of freedom and responsibility.


Experience that will set you apart

  • Experience using Google BigQuery, or equivalent;
  • Experience with DBT;
  • Experience working in a collaborative environment using GitHub;
  • Knowledge of data modelling principles;
  • A passion for education technology.


Company Benefits

  • Competitive compensation with 6 month pay reviews
  • Flexible / fully-remote working
  • Work abroad up to 3 months at a time
  • Full auto-enrolment workplace pension
  • High degree of autonomy and opportunity to become an integral member of a fast growing start up
  • Huge learning opportunities from experienced developers as well as exposure to all business areas of a start up
  • Opportunity to learn new technologies, including machine learning
  • Frequent team dinners and drinks
  • Office in Old Street
  • 28 days holiday + bank holidays
  • Enhanced parental leave


Interview Process

  • 30 minutes HR call
  • Task
  • 1.5 hours technical interview
  • 30 minutes culture fit interview

Title: Bi & Data Analyst
Description:
Our partner is on of the largest sustainable logistic operator in Europe, they are committed to drive and make a positive impact on the environment.

They are seeking a talented BI Analyst to join their dynamic team. In this role, you will play a key role in supporting our organizational strategy by creating and managing Reporting and Analytics solutions. Your expertise will be instrumental in turning data into actionable insights, driving informed decision-making across the organization.

Role


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into project charters.
Monitor the development and functionality of BI deliverables, ensuring alignment with end-user needs.
Provide proactive advice on process and system improvements.
Work closely with our Controlling & BI team to ensure consistency and alignment across all Reporting initiatives.


Profile


Bachelor/Master Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, or Economics.
Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in data analysis and reporting.
Proficiency in SQL queries and BI tools; knowledge of PySpark and Tableau is advantageous.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.


Offer


Opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects with a global impact.
Competitive compensation package and attractive benefits.
Flexibility to work autonomously and remotely.
Car or Mobility budget (up to 790EUR)
32 days of holidays

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a great workplace.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Key Responsibilities


Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
Integration‚ÄØbetween enterprise architecture and data collection.
Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis


Qualifications


You hold a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in IT.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive‚Ä¶
Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.


We Offer


A challenging and varied role in a growing company
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
Competitive salary and benefits
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group


If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Functie:

De afdeling Data and Analytics is het kloppend hart van Colruyt Group in het omgaan met informatie. Als Data Analist ontwikkel je BI-producten, analyseer je data en maak je deze inzichtelijk voor je eindgebruikers. Een leerrijke job met ruimte voor initiatief en verrijkende samenwerkingen!

Een greep uit jouw takenpakket:

Als Data Analist ga je in overleg met onze interne partners en directies om hun noden te verzamelen voor het bouwen van rapporten, cockpits en dashboards.
Je bent ook bij het verdere gehele proces betrokken. Dat betekent van het analyseren van datanoden tot het presenteren van de rapporten. Hierin werk je nauw samen met verschillende stakeholders zoals analisten, developers, projectmanagers en eindgebruikers.
Je ontwerpt, ontwikkelt en onderhoudt de semantische laag, de SAP BO Universe, die afgestemd is op het onderliggende datamodel.
Je stelt testscenario‚Äôs op en levert de nodige steun voor de validering van de producten.
Je documenteert de producten en leidt de eindgebruikers op zodat ze zich ermee vertrouwd voelen.
Je neemt deel aan de Business Intelligence-ombudswerking waarin je op basis van incidenten technische/functionele problemen analyseert en corrigerende acties uitvoert.

Je werkt op ons hoofdkantoor te Halle en kan tot 3 dagen per week van thuis uit werken.




Profiel:

Kennis en ervaring ‚Äì Je hebt een bachelor- of masterdiploma in bv. informatiemanagement of een andere data-gedreven studie, of hebt gelijkwaardige ervaring. Minstens 3 jaar ervaring in Power BI en/of Tableau en SQL is een must.
Communicatief ‚Äì Je bent communicatief ingesteld, bent een echte teamspeler, en legt vlot contact. Je capteert vlot noden bij je eindgebruikers en overlegt regelmatig. Je zoekt actief naar de beste oplossing.
Analytisch en conceptueel ‚Äì Je haalt vlot de te behandelen delen uit een complex gegeven en kan oorzaak en gevolg onderscheiden. Daarnaast heb je snel inzicht in complexe kwesties en plaats je de zaken in een breder perspectief.
Kwaliteit ‚Äì Je hebt een end-to-end mentaliteit en gaat steeds voor de hoogste kwaliteit in wat je oplevert. Je denkt vanuit oplossingen en bewaakt de balans tussen de wensen van je eindgebruikers en optimalisaties die tijdens het proces kunnen opduiken.
Talen ‚Äì Je communiceert vlot in het Nederlands en Engels, zodat je met al je collega‚Äôs en stakeholders goed kan samenwerken.




Wij bieden:

Aantrekkelijk loonpakket ‚Äì Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk loonpakket, gecombineerd met extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, winstdeelname en een hospitalisatieverzekering.
Opleidingen en leertrajecten ‚Äì Wij voorzien opleidingen die aansluiten bij je ervaring en behoeften. Je krijgt alle mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontplooien, zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak.
Eigen verantwoordelijkheden - We geven je de kans om je eigen verantwoordelijkheden op te nemen, maar ook om je eigen idee√´n en initiatieven mee vorm te geven.
Stimulerende werkomgeving ‚Äì Je werkt in een klein en divers team met collega‚Äôs die over verschillende vaardigheden beschikken.

Werken bij Colruyt Group, dat is elke dag onze missie waarmaken: samen duurzaam meerwaarde cre√´ren. Wij zorgen voor ondersteuning en kansen, jij kan initiatief nemen en idee√´n voorstellen. Wij ondersteunen je groei, want als jij groeit, dan doen wij dat ook.

Werken bij Colruyt Group, dat is elke dag onze missie waarmaken: samen duurzaam meerwaarde cre√´ren. Wij zorgen voor ondersteuning en kansen, jij kan initiatief nemen en idee√´n voorstellen. Wij ondersteunen je groei, want als jij groeit, dan doen wij dat ook.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Je komt terecht in de marketing tribe bij Telenet Business, de dynamische en groeiende B2B-circle binnen de Telenet groep. Nu B2B steeds meer datagedreven wordt, speel jij een cruciale rol in het overnemen van deze mindset en het verschaffen van de juiste inzichten. Je maakt deel uit van een klein dynamisch team dat verantwoordelijk is voor marketing intelligence, marketing automation, digital marketing en performance. De data analist werkt zeer nauw samen met de marketing collega's, zijn data analist collega's, data scientists maar ook met sales, solutions experts, business analisten.

Jouw rol als data analist


Als data analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het beheersen van commerci√´le data, zorg je ervoor dat deze door jou of andere collega's wordt opgeschoond en ondersteun je stakeholders met interessante business inzichten. Als je houdt van een verscheidenheid aan dataprojecten, in een complex datalandschap en om samen te werken met een veelheid aan stakeholders, dan ben jij onze persoon!
Je verzamelt, cleaned en valideert de gegevens die je nodig hebt uit verschillende bronnen.
Stelt klantenlijsten op, combineert relevante klant- en productgegevens om leadgeneratieacties, migraties en marketingacties voor te bereiden.
Zorg ervoor dat we de meest optimale gegevenskwaliteit in onze contacten hebben
Bepaal gegevensverbeteringen om ervoor te zorgen dat we de gegevenskwaliteit op peil houden en het beste halen uit de gegevens die we verzamelen
Stuur het commerci√´le team aan door bedrijfsinzichten en meer specifieke segmentinzichten te bieden. Ondersteun de business door nieuwe kansen te defini√´ren op basis van diepgaande data-analyse, suggesties om de prestaties te verbeteren, etc.
Cre√´er in Qlik nieuwe rapporten ter ondersteuning van zakelijke inzichten voor commerci√´le sturing.
Zorg ervoor dat we voldoen aan het GDPR-beleid van Telenet met betrekking tot B2B-klantgegevens.


We zijn op zoek naar een Data Analist met de volgende vaardigheden


Data-driven mindset met het vermogen om de juiste inhoudelijke KPI's vast te stellen en deze op te volgen.
Strong analytical and data skills, met kennis van Excel, SQL, SPSS en/of rapportageplatform. Ervaring met QlikSense is een voordeel.
Op je gemak zijn in een complexe omgeving met meerdere te beheren tools/bronnen
Samenwerken met een veelheid aan stakeholders van verschillende afdelingen binnen B2B
Goede presentatie- en vertelvaardigheden, zeker naar niet-data gedreven collega's
Een probleemoplossende en resultaatgerichte mindset
Uitstekende communicatie- en samenwerkingsvaardigheden in Nederlands en Engels, Frans is een pr√©.
Ervaring van minimaal 3-5 jaar als data/business/CRM-analist of in een vergelijkbare rol.


Wat kun je van ons verwachten?


Je komt terecht bij een bedrijf en een team die veel in je investeren en je werkomgeving waar mogelijk aanpassen aan je behoeften. We willen dat je jezelf ontwikkelt en zorgen tegelijkertijd voor een goede balans tussen werk en priv√©.
Je krijgt alle kansen om je expertise verder te ontwikkelen. We stimuleren je persoonlijke groei met interne mobiliteitsmogelijkheden en uitgebreide leermogelijkheden, maar geven je ook de kans om desgewenst op de pauzeknop te drukken of een heel ander pad in te slaan.
Een afwisselende baan waarin je tastbare resultaten zult boeken en je stempel zult drukken.
Een competitief bruto maandsalaris dat we aanvullen met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals kortingen op Telenet producten, maaltijdcheques, ... .
Een geweldig team van collega's die net zo gepassioneerd zijn als jij.
Je komt te werken in een geweldige moderne werkplek op Telenet HQ in Mechelen met de mogelijkheid om tot drie dagen per week thuis te werken

  • Bepaal gegevensverbeteringen om ervoor te zorgen dat we de gegevenskwaliteit op peil houden en het beste halen uit de gegevens die we verzamelen
  • Stuur het commerci√´le team aan door bedrijfsinzichten en meer specifieke segmentinzichten te bieden. Ondersteun de business door nieuwe kansen te defini√´ren op basis van diepgaande data-analyse, suggesties om de prestaties te verbeteren, etc.
  • Cre√´er in Qlik nieuwe rapporten ter ondersteuning van zakelijke inzichten voor commerci√´le sturing.
  • Zorg ervoor dat we voldoen aan het GDPR-beleid van Telenet met betrekking tot B2B-klantgegevens.

We zijn op zoek naar een Data Analist met de volgende vaardigheden

  • Data-driven mindset met het vermogen om de juiste inhoudelijke KPI's vast te stellen en deze op te volgen.
  • Strong analytical and data skills, met kennis van Excel, SQL, SPSS en/of rapportageplatform. Ervaring met QlikSense is een voordeel.
  • Op je gemak zijn in een complexe omgeving met meerdere te beheren tools/bronnen
  • Samenwerken met een veelheid aan stakeholders van verschillende afdelingen binnen B2B
  • Goede presentatie- en vertelvaardigheden, zeker naar niet-data gedreven collega's
  • Een probleemoplossende en resultaatgerichte mindset
  • Uitstekende communicatie- en samenwerkingsvaardigheden in Nederlands en Engels, Frans is een pr√©.
  • Ervaring van minimaal 3-5 jaar als data/business/CRM-analist of in een vergelijkbare rol.

Wat kun je van ons verwachten?

  • Je komt terecht bij een bedrijf en een team die veel in je investeren en je werkomgeving waar mogelijk aanpassen aan je behoeften. We willen dat je jezelf ontwikkelt en zorgen tegelijkertijd voor een goede balans tussen werk en priv√©.
  • Je krijgt alle kansen om je expertise verder te ontwikkelen. We stimuleren je persoonlijke groei met interne mobiliteitsmogelijkheden en uitgebreide leermogelijkheden, maar geven je ook de kans om desgewenst op de pauzeknop te drukken of een heel ander pad in te slaan.
  • Een afwisselende baan waarin je tastbare resultaten zult boeken en je stempel zult drukken.
  • Een competitief bruto maandsalaris dat we aanvullen met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals kortingen op Telenet producten, maaltijdcheques, ... .
  • Een geweldig team van collega's die net zo gepassioneerd zijn als jij.
  • Je komt te werken in een geweldige moderne werkplek op Telenet HQ in Mechelen met de mogelijkheid om tot drie dagen per week thuis te werken

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Voor een toonaangevend bedrijf in de energiesector zijn wij op zoek naar een Finance Data Analist in de regio Brussel.




Je verantwoordelijkheden zijn (maar niet beperkt tot):

Theoretische data governance omzetten in een praktische datacultuur
Financi√´le medewerkers verantwoordelijkheden geven op het gebied van data governance
Ondersteunen van innovatieve datapraktijken die bijdragen aan duurzaamheid en operationele excellentie
Financi√´le gegevens extraheren en interpreteren om strategische beslissingen te onderbouwen
Samenwerken met onze Agile/Scrum-teams om AI- en BI-oplossingen te integreren
Teamleden trainen in data-analysetools en -methodologie√´n
Zorgen voor gegevenskwaliteit en pleiten voor proactief gegevensbeheer
Communicatie tussen verschillende belanghebbenden vergemakkelijken
Datamanagement KPI's verbeteren en datasilo's tussen afdelingen aanpakken




Vereisten:

Diploma in financi√´n, economie, informatica, datawetenschappen of gelijkaardige opleiding
Ervaring in het transformeren van data naar bruikbare inzichten en het waarborgen van data compliance
Bewezen ervaring in het werken met agile en scrum teams
Strategisch denken en vaardigheid in het transformeren van complexe datasets naar bruikbare inzichten - affiniteit met tools voor statistische analyse
Sterke kennis van governance principes, waaronder datakwaliteit en -beheer
Kennis van Agile en Scrum metodologie√´n
Bekwaamheid met tools zoals SQL, Pyhton, R, Tableau en PowerBi
Teamplayer en het vermogen om positieve werkrelaties te onderhouden
Nederlands is vereist - zowel geschreven als gesproken. Engels zeer goed en Frans is een pluspunt




Aanbod

Voor deze functie van Finance data analyst bieden we een aantrekkelijk salaris met de volgende voordelen:

Groeps- & hospitalisatieverzekering
7 euro maaltijdcheque per werkdag
Vergoeding km of bedrijfswagen
Maandelijkse vergoeding (80 euro netto per maand)
Een 13e maand
Opleiding

Een tarief als freelancer is ook mogelijk.

Title: Azure Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms and cybersecurity. By combining creativity, tech and data insights, we empower our customers to transform their business and unlock the future.

With 25 years‚Äô experience and 10,000 employees across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, Devoteam promotes responsible tech for people and works to create better change.

Join our global community of exceptional talents at Devoteam, where you‚Äôll collaborate with multidisciplinary teams of data specialists, business consultants, solution architects, security experts, cloud engineers, developers, and more across over 20 countries in the EMEA region. As a member of our team, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to work with the world‚Äôs leading partners, including AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow, driving innovation and advancing your career.


Job Description

If you like these keywords, you‚Äôll love this role:

#data #azure #PowerBI #Reporting #Dashboarding #DataWarehouse #DataMart #StarSchema

Dreaming about exploring the data understanding how the business works? Do you enjoy telling a story around data? Do you enjoy figuring out how to calculate the needed KPI? We are currently looking for an Azure Data Analyst who can support our customers by telling a story around data by creating reports and dashboards.

Do you have experience with Power BI or with a similar reporting tool? Are you also interested in supporting our Azure Data Engineer team computing the right data set? Are you attracted by new technologies and new methodologies? You‚Äôre a good candidate to be our future colleague!

As an Azure Data Analyst, you will be a crucial part of our key projects for our data solutions. You will be in front of the customer understanding their need, creating the correct report and guiding our Azure Data Engineer to prepare properly the needed data.


Qualifications

For this position, we‚Äôre looking for all seniority levels.¬†

[Must-have] Hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services or Tableau
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL querying language (T-SQL)
[Must-have] Hands-on experience modeling a datawarehouse/datamart in Star Schema
[Must-have] Knowledge about modeling techniques like data vault, Merise/3NF
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience creating Azure resources for a data cloud solution.
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience building data pipeline with some Azure data tools (Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure Data Lake‚Ä¶)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with the DataBricks environment (Delta Live Table, Workflows, SQL Warehouse)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL Server suite (SSIS, SSAS)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with Python and PySpark
[Nice-to-have] You‚Äôre ready to drive change and bring creative tech ideas to life.
[Nice-to-have] You‚Äôre either proficient in Dutch or French (or you want to learn) and fluent in English.
[Bonus-points] Azure certified (or willing to obtain). Certifications in scope: PL-300, DP-203



If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don‚Äôt worry. Just apply. Together we‚Äôll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam.

Our promises to you

As a digital native you will have a positive impact at top organizations in Belgium.
Direct access to the Microsoft organization and programs thanks to our global partnership.
Prepare to inspire and be inspired by other Devoteamers in tech communities.
We enable local and international collaboration and exchange with other tech leaders and specialists, knowledge sharing, peer-to-peer coaching.
A personalized career plan with training offers in soft- & hard skills and certifications aligned to your needs & expertise.
Our servant leadership supports opportunities to grow your personal brand through blogs, keynote sessions, and more.


Additional Information

#techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.

Why choose us?

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it‚Äôs okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation.¬†
Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.

At Devoteam, we combine strong values ‚Äì respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

Title: Data Anlayst (finance background)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst with a strong finance background to join our team and work on the implementation of our new CRM system for the bank. The ideal candidate will have experience in finance, specifically as an accountant or auditor, and will be responsible for data transfer and integration.

Key Responsibilities:


Collaborate with the finance and IT teams to understand data requirements and ensure smooth data transfer during the CRM implementation.
Analyze and validate financial data to ensure accuracy and integrity.
Develop and maintain complex Excel spreadsheets, including pivot tables, data extraction, and VLOOKUP functions.
Utilize SQL and Python to manipulate and analyze data (preferred).
Ensure data quality and consistency throughout the migration process.
Generate reports and provide insights to support decision-making.
Communicate effectively in both French and English with internal and external stakeholders.


Qualifications:


Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst in the finance sector (accounting, auditing, etc.).
Strong proficiency in Excel, including pivot tables, data extraction, and VLOOKUP.
Familiarity with SQL and Python is a significant plus.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Bilingual proficiency in French and English is required.


Education:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance, Accounting, Data Analytics, or a related field.


Benefits:


Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional development and career growth.
Friendly and collaborative work environment.


To apply for the Data Analyst (Finance Background) position located in Brussels, please send your resume to CV@halian.com. Be sure to include the name of the position and location in the subject line of your email. We look forward to reviewing your application and exploring the possibility of you joining our dynamic team at Halian.

Title: Performance & Data Analyst F/M
Description:
Position description

Business unit

Operations, Data & IT - Operations, Client Servicing & Reporting

Job title

Performance & Data Analyst F/M

Contract type

Permanent

Candriam Group Presentation

Candriam is a global multi-specialist asset manager and a recognized pioneer and leader in sustainable investment. For more than 25 years, Candriam has offered innovative and diversified investment solutions across many asset classes including fixed income, equities, absolute return , asset allocation and illiquid assets.

As a Responsible Employer, Equal Employment Opportunity is crucial to Candriam. We are committed to building the best global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We provide an inclusive work environment and support wellbeing and work-life balance.

Mission

As a Performance & Data Analyst in our Performance Measurement team at Candriam, you are joining a global multi-specialist asset management firm renowned for its commitment to sustainable and responsible investments.

In this role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring the accuracy and integrity of our reporting data, essential for both external client reports and consumption by internal clients like the RFP team and Front Office.

Your work will encompass a broad spectrum of portfolio data relevant to our diverse investment solutions, including performance metrics, asset allocations, and holdings information. Your responsibilities will be pivotal in managing the performance engine's parameterization, overseeing the data flow process, and enhancing data quality.

This role is integral to feeding accurate and reliable data into our central data lake, supporting strategic decision-making and analysis across the company.

It requires a dedication to operational excellence and a proactive approach to developing your technical skills within the evolving landscape of sustainable asset management.

Responsabilities


You collect data from different sources and integrate it into the performance calculation tool
You maintain the set-up of the production scope
You manage the output of performance results to serve all business needs
You actively contribute to specific projects on creating value added services for internal and external clients
You provide innovative insight in data related to regulatory and business challenges
You assess, design and implement solutions in data management, data governance and data quality
You analyze systems and processes to make them more efficient and to make data delivery faster and more accurate.



Profile


You hold a Master in finance, economics or you are preferably performance measurement and GIPS
You have excellent reporting & data management skills
A previous experience with a performance analysis tool is an asset (Statpro, Bisam, Factset,..)
You have an analytical mind that is capable of creative and solution-oriented thinking in a continuous search for improvement
You are efficient and work in a structured and methodical way
You have an eye for detail, you are meticulous and pragmatic
You are a motivated person that can work in a dynamical environment and face challenges
You master MS Excel; Python skills required. knowledge of MS Access, VBA and SQL is an asset, Power BI skills are also a plus
You are fluent in English, French or Dutch





Job location


Candidate criteria

Education


Master's Degree I / Bac+4



Minimum Level Of Experience Required

2-5 years

Languages


English (C1 - Fluent)
Dutch (C1 - Fluent)

Title: Junior Data Engineer / Analist
Description:
Jouw avontuur in een notendop

Ontwikkelen, implementeren en onderhouden van data pipelines.
Analyseren van datasets om waardevolle inzichten te verkrijgen.
Ondersteunen bij het bouwen en optimaliseren van data-oplossingen.
Samenwerken met diverse teams om data-gedreven beslissingen te ondersteunen.
Rapporteren en visualiseren van data bevindingen voor stakeholders.




Waarom zou je voor tillit willen werken?

Uitgebreide opleidingsprogramma‚Äôs: Je volgt intensieve trainingen en cursussen om je technische vaardigheden en kennis te ontwikkelen.
Mentorship: Je krijgt een persoonlijke mentor toegewezen die je begeleidt en ondersteunt bij je carri√®reontwikkeling.
Doorgroeimogelijkheden: We stimuleren en faciliteren je groei naar meer senior rollen binnen het bedrijf.
Innovatieve werkomgeving: Je werkt met de nieuwste technologie√´n en tools binnen een dynamisch team van data-experts.
Flexibele werktijden: Wij bieden flexibele werktijden en de mogelijkheid tot thuiswerken.




Wie zoeken wij?

Je hebt een afgeronde bachelor- of masteropleiding in Informatica, Data Science, Wiskunde, Statistiek of een gerelateerd vakgebied.
Je hebt een sterke interesse in data engineering en analyse.
Basiskennis SQL.
Analytisch denkvermogen en oog voor detail.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en teamgeest.
Leergierig en gemotiveerd om jezelf continu te ontwikkelen.

HTML:
Jouw avontuur in een notendop

  • Ontwikkelen, implementeren en onderhouden van data pipelines.
  • Analyseren van datasets om waardevolle inzichten te verkrijgen.
  • Ondersteunen bij het bouwen en optimaliseren van data-oplossingen.
  • Samenwerken met diverse teams om data-gedreven beslissingen te ondersteunen.
  • Rapporteren en visualiseren van data bevindingen voor stakeholders.


Waarom zou je voor tillit willen werken?

  • Uitgebreide opleidingsprogramma‚Äôs: Je volgt intensieve trainingen en cursussen om je technische vaardigheden en kennis te ontwikkelen.
  • Mentorship: Je krijgt een persoonlijke mentor toegewezen die je begeleidt en ondersteunt bij je carri√®reontwikkeling.
  • Doorgroeimogelijkheden: We stimuleren en faciliteren je groei naar meer senior rollen binnen het bedrijf.
  • Innovatieve werkomgeving: Je werkt met de nieuwste technologie√´n en tools binnen een dynamisch team van data-experts.
  • Flexibele werktijden: Wij bieden flexibele werktijden en de mogelijkheid tot thuiswerken.


Wie zoeken wij?

  • Je hebt een afgeronde bachelor- of masteropleiding in Informatica, Data Science, Wiskunde, Statistiek of een gerelateerd vakgebied.
  • Je hebt een sterke interesse in data engineering en analyse.
  • Basiskennis SQL.
  • Analytisch denkvermogen en oog voor detail.
  • Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en teamgeest.
  • Leergierig en gemotiveerd om jezelf continu te ontwikkelen.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ben jij een‚ÄØervaren Data Analyst‚ÄØmet een passie voor‚ÄØveelzijdige uitdagingen?‚ÄØ

Duik in de fantastische wereld van data en inzichten.

De functie inhoud - Hoe ziet jouw takenpakket als‚ÄØData Analyst‚ÄØer uit?


Je analyseert behoeften vanuit de business en vertaalt deze naar de producten.
Je onderzoekt en analyseert mogelijke optimalisaties en verbeteringen in onze data en producten.
Je schrijft requirements zodat onze ontwikkelaars exact weten wat ze moeten doen.
Na implementatie test je de nieuwe ontwikkelingen of ze voldoen aan de beschreven verwachtingen
Je ondersteunt het R&D team met analyses op concrete bedrijfseconomische vraagstukken
Daarnaast verzorg je ook analyses op vraag van klanten en prospects


Het profiel - Pas jij als Data Analyst in onderstaand plaatje?


Je hebt minimaal een bacheloropleiding in een relevant vakgebied of je hebt‚ÄØrelevante werkervaring in data analyse.
Je bent vertrouwd om te werken met excel en SQL. Kennis van PowerBI,Tableau (of vergelijkbare programma‚Äôs) of programmeertalen zoals Python en R is een meerwaarde
Je hebt een oog voor detail en bent in staat nauwkeurig te werken onder deadlines.
Je bent probleemoplossend en pragmatisch in aanpak om steeds de beste oplossing te vinden.
Je drukt je vlot uit in het Nederlands en Engels om complexe materie eenvoudig over te brengen.


Het aanbod - Wat mag je verwachten?


Een uitdagende job met vast contract bij een stabiel bedrijf waar je nauw samen werkt met gepassioneerde en gedreven collega‚Äôs
In een omgeving te werken waar samenwerking, leren van elkaar en klantgerichtheid hoog in het vaandel staan.
Sterke work-life balance‚ÄØdoor middel van‚ÄØglijdende werkuren‚ÄØen‚ÄØthuiswerkmogelijkheden.
Een stevige on-the-job basisopleiding om te starten en je wordt voortdurend begeleid en ondersteund tijdens je verdere loopbaan.
Een interessant, vast salaris te genieten op basis van je ervaring. En een prima pakket aan andere voorwaarden zoals een hospitalisatieverzekering, groepsverzekering, extra vakantie dagen, maaltijdcheques, fiets lease‚Ä¶


Onze organisatie - Wie is GraydonCreditsafe?

Onze visie voor de toekomst is helder: met een internationaal aanbod en expertise in de Belgische markt combineren we internationale data en lokale intelligentie. GraydonCreditsafe is onderdeel van de Creditsafe Group, de meest gebruikte aanbieder van kredietinformatie met meer dan 125.000 klanten wereldwijd.

Onze klanten maken gebruik van onze oplossingen om hun risk en credit management, workflow, bedrijfsbeslissingen en commerci√´le opportuniteiten te ondersteunen en te optimaliseren. GraydonCreditsafe beschikt over de grootste database aan bedrijfsinformatie wereldwijd met meer dan 365 miljoen bedrijfsgegevens, over 160 landen - Data is het nieuwe goud en wint elke dag aan belang binnen elke onderneming.

Contact

Wil jij deel uitmaken van ons team?‚ÄØ Bezorg me dan zeker jouw CV!

‚Ää

Title: Digital Intelligence & Data Analyst
Description:
About Ogilvy Social.lab

Ogilvy Social.Lab (OSL) is a full-service advertising agency headquartered in Brussels‚Äô WPP Campus. As part of the international Ogilvy network, our operations span four continents with over 15 nationalities on the 130-strong team working in our offices ‚Äì our mindset is borderless.

We proudly collaborate with prominent international and regional clients, including Absolut, Mondelez, Ford, IKEA, Vans, EU and Belgian institutions, fueling their success internationally.

Entrepreneurship pulses through our veins, embodying our name with a "lab‚Äù mentality. We constantly innovate and experiment, staying in sync with the ever-evolving digital media landscape we specialize in.

Your Main Responsibilities


Analyse social and digital data through a set of tools (Social Listening tools like Synthesio, Competitive Analysis tools like RivalIQ, Audience Analysis tools like Profiler or Global Web Index, Trends and Search Analysis tools like Semrush or Social Lab Proprietary Tools, etc.) based on a client briefing. Develop custom approaches leveraging available data sets and technologies to deliver on actionable insights to inform strategic recommendations.
Support planners in developing data-validated strategies bringing data richness to what consumers, communities or creators are ‚Äòsaying‚Äô, ‚Äòsharing‚Äô and ‚Äòsearching‚Äô online.
Design insightful reports and audits with strategic recommendations.
Deliver high-quality service to local and international clients.
Collaborate with WPP and external data providers.
Participate in the creation of new, commercially viable data products.
Client-facing for the presentation of intelligence work.


Your Track Record Shows


2 to 6 years of experience in Social/Digital/Search Data Analytics, Insights and Digital/Social Strategy (seniority level to be determined based on your background and experience).
Strong research and analytical skills - understand how to apply qualitative and quantitative learnings and turn them into actionable insights
Comfortable using social and digital monitoring technologies such as Synthesio, Brandwatch, Meltwater, Semrush, etc.
Expert in the understanding of social media and established understanding of the wider digital communication landscape.
Ability to work effectively, proactively and seamlessly amongst an integrated agency team.
Eye for innovation and the next emerging platform or partner.


Must-have


Always-on social listening analysis and insights generation.
Cultural tracking (including trends) and insights generation for always-on and campaign use.
A strong understanding of today‚Äôs social media landscape and internet culture (Social 3.0, culture-first, community and creators led, audience-first) and new channels‚Äô codes.
A strong understanding of Social media performance metrics/KPIs for both organic and paid media.
Strong reporting and visualisation skills


Nice-to-have


Dashboarding, data collection and data visualisation experience
Sprinklr expertise
Knowledge of customer research is a plus


OFFER


Fulltime opportunity in an ever-growing, trendsetting advertising agency based in the greenest building in Brussels ‚Äì the new WPP Campus.
Work alongside a team of diverse and people-focused individuals, on impactful projects and with an array of local, regional and global clients.
We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
We thrive on transparency ‚Äì Our words and promises produce actions.
Enjoy attractive employment benefits including:
Flexible working policy; balanced mix of remote work and in-office presence options
Meal & Eco vouchers,
Cafeteria plan,
3 insurance options,
Continuous training,
Latest collaborative tech and tools to thrive,
Teambuilding & integration activities, Lunch&Learns...
As an Ogilvy Social. Lab employee, you will be provided with continuous opportunities to grow through training, and career conversations, while doing strong work, that works on a daily basis.

At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression.

We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities ‚Äì and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality.

Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve. This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
This is us, your new colleagues

Renault Trucks Belux is the pioneer of electric trucks in Belgium and stands for innovation and sustainability! As an importer, we are committed to the transition to emission-free transport and are proud of our leading electric trucks, vans and, more recently, our cargo bikes. Our customers are transport companies, logistics companies and all entities that need transport solutions.

We want to unburden our customers by proactively responding to their needs and being very close to their business. Every day, our sales team is committed with passion and expertise to propose the right transport solution to our current and future customers. The reduction of CO2 emissions is the priority of these solutions and our industry.

We would like to strengthen our team with a Business Intelligence Analyst!

Your ideal job?

The Business Intelligence Analyst has the overall responsibility in driving a data culture within the Belux organization. You will report to the Retail & Marketing Manager and work closely with business users, understand their needs and prepare reports based on their requirements.

In This Role, You Are Expected To


Create and maintain dashboards in Power BI, communicate results. These reports are related to sales performance, market research, competitor analysis, price segmentation, forecasting and service market performance.
Share insights with stakeholders, both internally as externally to the dealers.
Based on requirements from business users, gather, clean and process data and create reports, refresh/update them on regular basis.
Maintain mappings and master data needed for reports ‚Äì segmentation mapping, company, vehicle and customer master data.
Maintain automation flows for refreshing dashboards.
Explore new data sources ‚Äì external and internal.
Prepare and communicate both ad-hoc and planned reports and presentations in order to facilitate management decisions.
Set up or review processes related to our data environment.


Are we 'the perfect match'?

We Are Seeking Candidates Who Meet The Following Criteria


University degree or equivalent qualification
A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in the specified domain
Strong analytical abilities
A teamplayer, comfortable in an international environment, with effective communication skills, both written and oral
Presentation skills suitable for various audiences.
Problem-solving capabilities and the ability to bridge gaps.
Proactive mindset with a business-oriented approach.
Technical proficiency in the following areas: Office 365; Visualization software (Power BI); SQL; Python programming (Databricks); Automation (Power Automate)
Proficient in English; knowledge of French and/or Dutch (or willingness to learn).


Almost convinced?

We offer you the opportunity to build an exciting career at a company with ambition in the field of sustainability in the broad sense with a flat organization. We offer you a collegial, informal atmosphere and opportunities for personal development through contact with your expert colleagues as well as a focus on training. You can expect an attractive salary based on your knowledge and experience complemented by an interesting package of extra-legal benefits.

If you recognize yourself in this profile, make sure your candidature catches the eye!

For more information reach out to Mieke Meul (HR & Competence Manager); hr.belux@renault-trucks.com or by phone on 0491/35.92.86.

Renault Trucks is part of the Volvo Group.

The Volvo Group promotes prosperity through transport solutions and offers trucks, buses, construction machinery, marine and industrial energy solutions, financing, and services that increase our customers' employability and productivity. Founded in 1927, the Volvo Group is committed to shaping the future landscape of sustainable transportation and infrastructure solutions. The group's leading brands - Volvo, Volvo Penta, Terex Trucks, SDLG, Renault Trucks, Prevost, Nova Bus, Mack, Eicher, Dongfeng Trucks and Arquus - offer numerous career opportunities.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Joining Collibra‚Äôs Product Operations team

Collibra brings trust to data and AI through flexible and governed catalog, continuous quality and built-in privacy for the world‚Äôs leading brands. Headquartered in New York City and Brussels, Collibra works with 700+ customers worldwide and partners with the most innovative companies. We are on a mission to unite organizations with data that's easy to find, understand, trust and access.

Collibra brings trust to data and AI through flexible and governed catalog, continuous quality and built-in privacy for the world‚Äôs leading brands. Headquartered in New York City and Brussels, Collibra works with 700+ customers worldwide and partners with the most innovative companies. We are on a mission to unite organizations with data that's easy to find, understand, trust and access.

The team: Collibra‚Äôs Product Operations team works at the intersection of Product, Customer Success, Sales, and Engineering. Our mission is to be a trusted partner, providing processes and information that deliver a better experience and more value to our customers, faster.

The role: We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to analyze our product usage, content, and operational data, and work with stakeholders to drive efficiency, quality, and scale.

You will report to the VP of Product Operations and work primarily with stakeholders across all functions in Product. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with other Business and Data Intelligence Analysts across Collibra to develop a culture of data-driven decision-making.

The BI Analyst at Collibra is responsible for


Working hand-in-hand with subject matter experts to define key metrics and data gathering methodologies for various exciting initiatives, focusing mainly on product, customer, and user analytics.
Designing, developing, and continuously improving useful and user-friendly reporting and analytics solutions.
Creating engaging dashboards and visualizations to showcase key metrics.
Turning complex data findings into clear, actionable recommendations for internal stakeholders and leaders.


You have


2+ years of experience in analytics and reporting, preferably in a SaaS context.
Deep appreciation for data. You understand more than most that good data leads to outcomes, and want to learn with the best.
Experience in data exploration and wrangling. You can interrogate data stored in relational databases with SQL and productionalize data pipelines using tools like dbt. Programming experience with Python and/or Java is a plus.
Experience in data modeling. You operate with an understanding of thoughtful model design, query performance, and code maintainability.
Exposure to SaaS productivity tools. You‚Äôve used or understand the purpose of tools like Jira, Salesforce, Pendo, Centercode, Aha!, Zendesk and Collibra.
A bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent related working experience is required


You are


A story teller, with experience visualizing data effectively. You can make data tell the story, using business intelligence tools like Tableau, Looker or Power BI.
A builder, creating data products to solve problems and unlock growth.
An excellent communicator. You can present your ideas succinctly and effectively in excellent written and spoken English. Other languages are a plus‚Äîour team speaks over seven!
A customer champion, translating usage patterns into product improvements.
A team player, helping us grow our business and growing with it.


Measures of success


First Month: Build relationships within the Product Operations team, understand our product tools, processes, and data landscape, and start supporting existing reporting initiatives.
Third Month: Establish relationships with key SMEs, continuously improve existing reporting initiatives, and start developing your own.
Sixth Month: Successfully roll out your first data product for Product & Engineering.


Compensation for this role

This position is not eligible for additional commission-based compensation. Salary offers are based on a combination of factors, including, but not limited to, experience, skills, and location.

In addition to base salary, we offer equity ownership at every level, bonus potential, a Flex Fund monthly stipend, pension/401k plans, and more.

Benefits

Collibra recognizes and values that everyone has different needs, interests, and life goals. We built our {Be}well benefits program with flexibility in mind to support you and your loved ones through a diverse range of circumstances and life events. These flexible offerings sit on a foundation of competitive compensation, health coverage, and time off.

Professional Development

Collibrians are ambitious and inventive, and we want to develop our skills individually and as a team. You‚Äôll have access to development opportunities, as well as other rewards and recognition programs to help grow your career.

Health Coverage

We strive to remain locally competitive and globally equitable. This means comprehensive offerings including medical, dental, vision, and mental health benefits for you and your family.

Paid Time Off and Flexibility

We provide unlimited paid time off, global leave policies for a variety of personal and family circumstances, company-wide wellness days off throughout the year, meeting-free Wednesdays, and a flexible culture to help balance your work and your life.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

We create inclusion and belonging through how we onboard, meet, connect, engage, and communicate. Learn more about diversity, equity, and inclusion at Collibra.

Learn More About Collibra‚Äôs Benefits.

At Collibra, we‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity employer ‚Äì which ties directly to our core value, ‚Äúopen, direct, and kind.‚Äù We realize the key to creating a company with a world-class culture and employee experience comes from who we hire and creating a workplace that celebrates everyone.

With this, we proudly consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, sex, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, HIV status, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status or any other legally protected category. If you have a need that requires accommodation, let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.
