Title: Senior Data Analyst B2C
Description:
Job Description:


Location: Fully remote, EU timezone (CET +/- 2hours)
Start date: ASAP
Languages: English is mandatory; French is a plus
Our client: Cloud Computing / Distributed Systems / AI - European Saas



Objectives of this Role:


Analyze and interpret market and user data to drive business decisions and improve product offerings.
Develop and maintain robust data architecture for efficient data processing and analysis.
Present data insights in a clear, actionable manner to stakeholders across the company.
Understand and navigate the complexities of app marketing and related data restrictions.
Support product development and commercial objectives by providing data-driven insights and recommendations.



Responsibilities:


Design, implement, and manage backend data architecture to support analytics and reporting needs.
Collect, process, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights about user behavior, product performance and growth roadmaps.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to present data in an understandable and actionable way.
Collaborate with product, business, engineering and management teams to align data initiatives with company goals.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in data science, nalytics, and B2C app marketing and educate stakeholders on best practices.
Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices in data handling.
Augment the company with relevant Ai toolings to grow and scale with data insights.



Skills and Qualifications:


8+ years of proven working experience in data science, analytics, or a related field in tech/ cloud/ software domain.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools like Mixpanel, Domo or similar.
Solid understanding of backend data architecture and database management.
Ability to interpret complex data and present it in a clear, concise manner.
Familiarity with data privacy regulations and best practices.
Excellent problem-framing, problem solving and project management skills.
Excellent communication skills with proficiency in English.



Preferred Qualifications:


Experience in the B2C app companies, particularly with user data analysis.
Commercial acumen and the ability to align data insights with business objectives.
Understanding of app marketing strategies and associated data restrictions.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques and their application in business contexts.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Fluency in AI-powered toolings to optimize productivity and efficiency.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer




Location: Belgium Hybrid




About Us:

Our Client is a leading innovator committed to leveraging cutting-edge technology and data-driven insights to deliver exceptional value to their clients. They are seeking a talented Data Engineer to join a dynamic team in Belgium. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work on challenging projects, collaborate with a diverse team, and contribute to our mission of driving digital transformation.




Responsibilities:

Data Architecture & Design: Design, develop, and maintain scalable data architectures, including databases, data warehouses, and data lakes.
ETL Processes: Build and manage robust ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) pipelines to ensure the seamless flow of data from various sources to our data platforms.
Data Integration: Integrate data from multiple data sources and formats, ensuring data consistency, quality, and reliability.
Data Management: Implement data governance and security policies to ensure data privacy and compliance with relevant regulations.
Performance Optimization: Optimize database performance, query execution, and data storage solutions to enhance system efficiency and speed.
Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver high-quality data solutions.
Innovation: Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies, proposing innovative solutions to improve our data infrastructure and processes.



Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience: 3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL).
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Kafka).
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their data services.
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL tools (e.g., Apache Nifi, Talend, Airflow).
Soft Skills:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Attention to detail and a commitment to data quality.



Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Knowledge of machine learning frameworks and tools.
Understanding of GDPR and other data protection regulations relevant to Belgium and the EU.
Proficiency in both English and Dutch or French.



What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative and inclusive work environment.
The chance to work on impactful projects with cutting-edge technologies.

Title: Medior Data Analyst
Description:
For one of our partner which is a international payment service provider, we are looking for a Data analyst.

As a Data Analyst, you will join the Data Analytics & CRM team within the Strategy & Marketing department. Your role will be to support the optimization of marketing and sales performance by providing insights and decision-making tools based on data analysis from activities. You will work collaboratively with various business teams and play a crucial role in strengthening the company's data-driven culture.

Role


Collecting and processing data from various sources, analyzing and interpreting it to identify trends and strategic conclusions.
Supporting the definition of action plans and participating in the identification of business priorities through learnings & analyses. Proposing actions and recommendations based on conducted analyses.
Implementing monitoring of actions' performances within the organization and measuring, tracking, and communicating their results.
Participating in the development of reporting and dashboarding environment in Power BI, by collecting and translating business needs, defining KPIs, and assisting in development validation. Providing support to business teams in the use and evolution of dashboards.
Contributing to the development and management of new BI projects and actions.
Conducting ad hoc analyses to support strategic thinking or address specific questions.
Being the main point of contact to answer data-related questions.
Participating in improving data quality and enrichment.


Profile


You have a passion for data and enjoy working with numbers.
You master statistical methods and techniques for data analysis.
You have experience in visualization and reporting tools, such as PowerBI.
You have perfect mastery of Excel.
You have strong analytical skills and synthesis skills, and you can structure complex situations.
You have a critical mindset.
You are rigorous and precise and pay attention to details.
You have an innovative mindset and are interested in new data management and BI solutions.
You enjoy working independently and being proactive.
You are fluent in French or Dutch. Knowledge of English is a plus.


Offer


Competitive salary package + car + benefits
Flexible working environment (hybrid system)
Start asap
Young and dynamic team
Mobility budget

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
Robert Half Technology is currently looking for a Master Data Analyst ad interim (m/f/x) for a 18 months assignment.

The company is based in Brussels region.

As Master Data Analyst ad interim you will be responsible for the following tasks:


Entering all the data of different databases in line with the data standards and policies
Responsible for a smooth data maintenance in Enterprise Back End system
Able to investigate data integration issues and provide guidance to solve them
Works with the functional and technical team members to support data preparation for the data migration process (analyses existing legacy data and provides required information and/or files enabling the data transformation)


The requested qualifications for the Master Data Analyst ad interim position include:


Hands on mentality
Language: Dutch/English/French
Knowledge of software and SAP knowledge is an advantage


Interested in this position? Apply today.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We ontwerpen en implementeren ICT, telecom en audiovisuele oplossingen. Dit omvat zowel software als hardware.

Onze oplossingen zijn altijd in co-creatie met onze klanten. We inspireren hen graag met innovatieve technologie√´n, net zoveel als wij er zelf door ge nspireerd worden.

Axians is een merk van VINCI Energies. Als Groep hebben we de mogelijkheid om creatieve oplossingen te ontwerpen en slimme aanbiedingen te ontwikkelen, waarbij we een beroep kunnen doen op de expertise van andere merken van VINCI Energies wanneer nodig. Ons gedecentraliseerd model stelt onze mensen in staat om innovatie op lokaal niveau te ontwikkelen, waardoor producten ontstaan die vervolgens op grotere schaal kunnen worden ingezet.

Gebeten door data? Help onze klanten om een competitief voordeel te bereiken door data te verzamelen, transformeren en te visualiseren als betekenisvolle informatie!

Je functie


Jouw doel is om bedrijven op een hoger niveau van maturiteit met informatie te brengen, door hen te helpen interne en externe data optimaal in te schakelen om een competitief voordeel te bereiken.
Je werkt samen met de klant om informatiebehoeftes te identificeren.
Je ontwikkelt in team data warehouses en data lakes om de waardevolle informatie te ontsluiten.
Je ontwikkelt ETL- en data gedreven Artificial Intelligence-oplossingen om de klant in zijn dagelijkse taken te ondersteunen.


Je profiel


master of bachelor in een ICT-richting, industrieel ingenieur, handelsingenieur of een andere technische richting
interesse in Backend Informatiesystemen; databases en SQL hebben geen geheimen voor jou.
Passie voor Business Analytics, ETL ontwikkeling en Knowledge Discovery oplossingen.
ervaring met √©√©n of meer van volgende domeinen is een plus:
ETL tools: IBM DataStage, Microsoft SSIS, Azure Synapse, Databricks
Database platformen: SQL Server, Oracle, DB2, Azure datalake, Snowflake
Knowledge Discovery: Spss Modeler, R, Python
Je kan je gemakkelijk verplaatsen naar klanten in de driehoek Brussel/Antwerpen/Gent.


VINCI Energies wil een inclusieve werkgever zijn, een plek waar iedereen zich goed voelt, waar iedereen gelijke kansen krijgt, ongeacht geslacht, gender of cultuur .

Alle zij's, die's en hij's hebben het recht om te zijn wie ze zijn en moeten de kans krijgen om zich ten volle te ontplooien. Wij zien diversiteit als een sterkte en het is onze basis voor duurzaam ondernemen. Daarom staan onze vacatures open voor iedereen die voldoet aan de competenties zoals omschreven in de jobomschrijving.

Je organisatie


Axians maakt deel uit van de sterke groep VINCI Energies
Teamwerk, organisatiebetrokkenheid en zelfontwikkeling
Variatie door verschillende klanten en activiteiten
Opleiding op maat om je start optimaal te begeleiden
Duidelijke loopbaanpaden met zicht op je toekomst en doorgroeimogelijkheden
Compleet verloningspakket met flexibiliteit en extralegale voordelen
Een gedreven √©n waardengedreven organisatie met oog voor mens & maatschappij
Tal van initiatieven rond kennisdeling, sportieve, culturele en/of familiale activiteiten
Mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

Title: Medior Data Analyst
Description:
For one of our partner which is a international payment service provider, we are looking for a Data analyst.

As a Data Analyst, you will join the Data Analytics & CRM team within the Strategy & Marketing department. Your role will be to support the optimization of marketing and sales performance by providing insights and decision-making tools based on data analysis from activities. You will work collaboratively with various business teams and play a crucial role in strengthening the company's data-driven culture.

Role


Collecting and processing data from various sources, analyzing and interpreting it to identify trends and strategic conclusions.
Supporting the definition of action plans and participating in the identification of business priorities through learnings & analyses. Proposing actions and recommendations based on conducted analyses.
Implementing monitoring of actions' performances within the organization and measuring, tracking, and communicating their results.
Participating in the development of reporting and dashboarding environment in Power BI, by collecting and translating business needs, defining KPIs, and assisting in development validation. Providing support to business teams in the use and evolution of dashboards.
Contributing to the development and management of new BI projects and actions.
Conducting ad hoc analyses to support strategic thinking or address specific questions.
Being the main point of contact to answer data-related questions.
Participating in improving data quality and enrichment.


Profile


You have a passion for data and enjoy working with numbers.
You master statistical methods and techniques for data analysis.
You have experience in visualization and reporting tools, such as PowerBI.
You have perfect mastery of Excel.
You have strong analytical skills and synthesis skills, and you can structure complex situations.
You have a critical mindset.
You are rigorous and precise and pay attention to details.
You have an innovative mindset and are interested in new data management and BI solutions.
You enjoy working independently and being proactive.
You are fluent in French or Dutch. Knowledge of English is a plus.


Offer


Competitive salary package + car + benefits
Flexible working environment (hybrid system)
Start asap
Young and dynamic team
Mobility budget
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Context of the mission / Objective(s) of the job

We are looking for a Data Engineer Service, who will primarily join one of our product Teams. It is an opportunity to mark with your signature our corporate Data organization, and contribute indirectly to better product to manage our Customer, as more qualitative data or service around data for our customer.

We are looking for Data Engineers able to create data pipelines, efficient Storage structures, powerful materialized views in different analytical technologies, but also data exchange endpoints at destination of our users. To some extent, you'll also have to interact with aspect related to governance tools (Glossary, Modeling, Lineage, or Data Quality...).

Responsibilities

What will be your mission and for which competences will you need an Extensive hands-on experience (> 3 to 5 years preferable) in 2 out of the 4 following categories


Usage of the SQL server
Implementing data pipelines using Azure services such as Azure Databricks, but also to some extent Azure Data Factory, Azure Functions, Azure Stream/log Analytics, and Azure DevOps
Implementing data pipelines or data enrichments with Python in a Databricks environment
Open to learn and jump on new technologies (on the ones listed above, or also Redis, RabbitMQ, Neo4j, or Apache Arrow, ...)
Able and willing to interact with business analysts and stakeholders to refine some requirements and to present reusable and integrated solution
Able and willing to contribute to extensive testing of the solution, as the reinforcement of DevOps principles within the team.
Able and willing to contribute to the writing and structuration of documentation


What you will Not be doing:


You shall not act from an Ivory Technical Tower
You don't not make decisions for the Business but rather advise them with careful logic or showing your reasoning
You shall not deliver technical solution, rather product features


Requirements

As a candidate for this mission, you should also be able to demonstrate non-technical skills:


Able to challenge your interlocutors by leveraging your rational thinking, and no non-sense philosophy
Continuously look at data in a transversal way (no siloes), across the entire Enterprise, to maximize coherence, reuse and adoption
Track record of driving results through continuous improvement
Customer-oriented
Thinking Iterative
Analytical approach to problem-solving and a track record of driving results through continuous improvement
Team player breathing respect, open-mind, dare, challenge, innovation and one team/voice for the Customer
Product-oriented mindset
Enjoy sharing ideas with the team (or with other teams) and contribute to the product success
Language skills: fluent in English (must have) AND fluent in German/French or Dutch (soft requirement)
Good communication skills
Show more

Title: Data Visualization Specialist/ Tableau Expert
Description:
Our client, a major actor within the banking sector, is looking for a Data Visualization Specialist and Tableau expert!




In a context of Sales Performance evolution and strong digitalisation, it is necessary to respond to the growing needs by creating dashboards:

- that is able to easily create and maintain dashboards in Tableau

- that helps and supports the current Tableau users within the team




Description of the function:




The Data Visualization Specialist and Tableau Expert will support the internal clients and realize several different data reporting‚Äôs and visualization projects by:

Understanding and identifying, together with the stakeholders, their reporting and visualization needs,
Capturing the requirements and translating them firstly into a prototype and secondly into a full Tableau dashboard,
Presenting the full Tableau Dashboards to our stakeholders and get their feedback for later updates
Developing, updating, optimizing, publishing & decommissioning (= full life-cycle) reports/dashboards in accordance with the data & reporting governance guidelines,
Striving for the most optimal solution for the development and automation of reports/dashboards,
Collaborating with our Data Engineers in order to create adequate and sustainable data solutions for Tableau dashboards
Setting-up, advocating and implementing reporting and visualization best practices, in accordance with the guidelines and standards defined by the client,
Being the guardian & ambassador of this governance put in place.




Requirements:




At least 3 years of experience in dashboarding & reporting (Tableau)
Experience with SQL (writing and understanding queries, ‚Ä¶)
Knowledge of functioning of ETL tool (SAS Programming / SAS EGP) and DBMS Systems (Oracle / Sybase)
Soft skills: team player, problem-solver, good analytical and synthesis skills, ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment

Show more

  • Soft skills: team player, problem-solver, good analytical and synthesis skills, ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment

Title: Data & Analytics Consultant
Description:
Mission

YOUR FUNCTION:

Within the Digital Connected Company & Innovation we focus on helping our clients unlock the value within data. In order to support our unit, we are looking for Big Data / Analytics/ AI consultants who are able to implement an End-2-End data platform.

A data platform designed and driven by business value, is able to ingest data in a proper way, can manage the data quality, can store data securely and offers possibilities for integration with client-specific platforms.

As a Data & Analytics Consultant you have experience with multiple aspects of data: from (master)data management, over big data, data lakes, data visualization to data science and machine learning. You can use data in both a traditional data context (dashboard and reports), but also use it within the modern era of big data solutions, artificial intelligence and advanced analytics.

You have experience in one or more of these domains:


You are able to listen to business people, understand their challenge and shape a data solution that brings value.
Set up data platforms and the data management (the data model, integration, authorization), with all the components needed to support the data strategy of the customer (AI capabilities, Visualization, MDM,..)
Build data science or machine learning solutions that will bring business value. Build and optimize the best possible algorithm but also a webservice or application that can be used in an operational environment
Visualize the data on the best possible way: from a cooperate dashboards, an interactive report to a full self-service environment
Set up processes and governance that will be enabler for a data-driven culture (data stewardship, golden record, data lineage,..)


Profile

YOUR PROFILE


You obtained a master‚Äôs degree in applied statistics, computer science, engineering or similar by experience
You are passionate about data and analytics technology and trends
Have at least 3 years‚Äô experience in implementing data solution and analytics
You are fluent in Python or R
Have knowledge about data architecture, data integration, big data, data lakes, data visualization, computer vision, natural language processing, machine learning
You have experience with different data consumption techniques from traditional to more advanced analytics and AI perspective. (Power BI, Tableau, PyTorch, TensorFlow‚Ä¶)
Or you have hands-on experience with data platforms (e.g Azure, AWS, Google, Databricks, Boomi, Collibra, snowflake‚Ä¶) and are not afraid to dive into something you don‚Äôt know.
Have at least 1 year experience with Relational database technology
Have at least 1 year experience with NoSQL database technology
You have a good understanding of clustering, predictive modeling techniques and recommender systems
You have a pro-active, can-do mindset
You communicate clearly in Dutch and/or French and English (both written and spoken).


You get bonus points if‚Ä¶


You can present and defend your solutions in front of clients
You are able to organize, facilitate and lead workshops


OUR OFFER:


The opportunity to have a meaningful job where you can make a difference
The chance to continuously evolve as a professional, coupled with a variety of training opportunities
Relevant career opportunities to get you where you want to be, with the IT knowledge you need
Inetum-Realdolmen wants you to find a balance between work and private life by offering flexible hours, satellite offices and home working
32 days of annual leave, because life isn‚Äôt all about working
Forget about the miles: we provide you with a company car and a national fuel card
Group insurance and hospitalization insurance, because we care about you
And of course, we also offer a gross salary. One which is optimized from a net perspective for our employees!


Interested? Questions? Recommendations? For more information, contact your recruiter Pino Amico via pino.amico@inetum-realdolmen.world

Organization

Inetum Realdolmen, a member of the European Inetum Group with approximately 1,950 highly qualified employees, provides strategic, tactical and operational ICT solutions for over 1,000 customers throughout the Benelux. In every cooperation, Realdolmen realizes the potential of people and organizations and strives to keep ICT human. We are driven by technological innovation, but we advance at the speed of your ambition, results-focused and managing fundamental change.

Our company motto "New Challenges, New Ideas" reflects this.

An employer you really want to work for!

Not only is Realdolmen a no-nonsense, solid, stable and experienced company with great in-house knowledge and expertise, but we also put our employees first: every individual receives the attention they need. ‚ÄòHeart for People' is more than just words for us ‚Äì it's one of our very core values.

Satellite offices, extensive training opportunities, work-life balance, competence reviews and career opportunities: these are no empty promises for us. Our organization attaches great importance to diversity. We guarantee an objective selection process, whereby candidates are tested and selected solely on the basis of their qualities and skills.

With us it's all about you!

Title: Job | Data Analist C2N | Brussel
Description:
Omschrijving

Je levert data-analyses en rapporten op. Zo draag je bij tot de verbetering en monitoring van commerci√´le en operationele prestaties.

De job in een notendop

Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de oplevering van rapporten en analyses. Vragen vanuit de businessafdelingen (Marketing, Distributie, Contact Center) vertaal je in gedetailleerde data requirements. En je gebruikt de juiste bronnen: sociodemografische bronnen en bronnen in verband met productuitrusting, klantenrentabiliteit, risicoprofielen, onlinegedrag, CRM en verkoopgegevens.

Je staat ook in voor de oplevering van rapporten en analyses. In samenwerking met de data engineers en gebruikmakend van SQL, Azure en Python bouw je de onderliggende datastructuren op waarop de rapporten zullen draaien en die kunnen dienen voor nieuwe analyses. En je zorgt voor de uitbouw van de visualisaties van de rapporten in dashboards met behulp van QlikSense.

Samen met data governance harmoniseer en centraliseer je ook concepten, met duidelijke owners, stewards en kwaliteitscontroles.

Jij hoeft geen witte raaf te zijn

Al kan je er bij ons wel √©√©n worden. We zoeken vooral een straffe persoonlijkheid met een learning mindset.

Bij ons mag je volop je vleugels uitslaan als je iemand bent met:


Een STEM diploma (Science, Technology, Engineer, Mathematichs), of een diploma in handels-/economische wetenschappen en/of relevante werkervaring
Een voorliefde voor cijfers en een sterke analytische capaciteiten
Een gezonde dosis nieuwsgierigheid en een interesse in business en marketing concepten
Sterke communicatievaardigheden



Je scoort extra met:


Tweetaligheid (Nederlands/Frans) en kennis van het Engels
Oog voor detail en datanuances
Het vermogen om een massa aan gegevens samen te vatten en om te zetten in kerninzichten



Belfius koestert zijn talenten

Behalve de kans om elke dag te shinen, bieden wij jou een fulltime contract van onbepaalde duur met:


Een mooi loon aangevuld met een innovatief aanbod om een persoonlijk budget samen te stellen dat je kan besteden volgens je voorkeuren (bv. wagen, fiets, pc, smartphone, tablet, huisvesting onder bepaalde voorwaarden) en extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, personeelsvoordeel op eigen producten en diensten, en een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Mogelijkheden te over om je te ontwikkelen door een brede waaier aan opleidingen en carri√®rekansen in de hele Belfius-groep
Een goede werk-priv√© balans dankzij flexibele uren, de combinatie kantoor- en thuiswerk en een aantrekkelijk aantal vakantiedagen
Een moderne werkplek in het hart van Brussel met een coole fitness, een lekker gezond restaurant en gezellige ontmoetingsruimtes, dit alles op wandelafstand van de winkelstraat, het treinstation Brussel-Noord en de metrohalte Rogier

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our client in the Zurich area.




Your responsibilities will include data analysis, creating reliability metrics, establishing engineering standards, and offering data consulting.




If you have extensive experience in data analysis, data visualization, and monitoring systems, along with strong skills in English and proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Python, this role is ideal for you.




Knowledge of German is advantageous.




For further details about this position, apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Seeking an organized and detail-oriented data base squinted person to oversee our sustainability
data acquisition, dissemination, and project management.
We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented professional to join our team and oversee the
effective utilization of internal and external data tools and services to support business operations
and facilitate informed decision-making



1. AIDA: Incident Database Management:
First Priority: AIDA is an inhouse adverse Incident Database which has been launched a year ago
* Work closely with regions to plan and enhance the incident tracking and emergency helpline
improvements, ensuring all stakeholders are aligned and improvements are made where
needed.
* Lead and Support regions & countries to achieve the improvement targets for 2024,
including historical data uploads, helpline trainings, etc.
* Oversee and conduct basic maintenance on AIDA system, cooperate with HSE & IT teams.
* Provide user support including by handling access rights, keeping important information
correct and UpToDate, and promptly addressing any questions or issues raised by users.
* Compile and distribute incident data reports and dashboards to key stakeholders, including
regulatory teams and regional/global teams for insights.
* Onboard and explain the details of Incident management programs, AIDA, dashboards, and
data insights to new stakeholders.
2. Manage 3P and internal tools and services for internal stakeholders to support business
to track data and deliver insights:
Agrolense Data Collection Platform:
* Ensure seamless operation, maintenance, and continuous enhancement of the Agrolense
data collection platform in alignment with business requirements

Collaborate with the 6G team to fine-tune the platform and generate insightful reports for
dissemination to key stakeholders, including the SYT teams in IN, ID, AME, Value Chain
team -Kellogg, CLKS and KAP project teams.
* Guarantee the successful integration of API link with CFT (external service) for on-farm
carbon footprint measurement within the Agrolense platform.
* Global Safe Use training data collection tool: Take charge of project management in
collaboration with the core team to finalize data collection parameters and visualization
needs (establish 6G API link to Qliksense)
"BIR" tool: House made intranet-based business decision support tool
* Coordinate with the business team to finalize the visual, content and wording aspects of the
tool, ensuring alignment with brand and corporate guidance, legal requirement.
* Collaborate with the SYT IT team to implement changes to the tool in a timely manner,
making certain that project team approves the finalized specifications prior to launch.
3. Others:
* Monitor the quality and integration of North America Propharma (separate database) with
the global database on a quarterly basis, aligning with EPA and product design codes in
collaboration with the IT team.
* Assess and leverage Publication based incident data provided by the product safety team
for continuous improvement.
* Manage AIDA Power BI dashboard and explore the possibility to leverage MS "Copilot".
Project and Budget Management for Sustainability Activities:
* Ensure accurate and timely updates of sustainability activities on Smartsheet for both global
and regional initiatives.

Skills:
Excellent project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects
simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills for working with teams across different
regions and countries.
* Collaborative team player with the ability to work independently.
* Experience in coordinating projects and working with cross-functional teams.
* Skilled in data visualization dashboard, analysis and generating insights from data.
* Experience in coordinating IT projects and cross-functional teams using multiple databases.

Proven experience in data management and support.

Education:
Requires a bachelor's degree in area of specialty.

Title: Data analyst (H/F)
Description:
Pour notre division Syst√®me d‚ÄôInformation, nous recherchons un Data Analyst (H/F) afin de rejoindre le groupe Data Analytics, au sein duquel il aura la responsabilit√© de mettre en place et d'administrer les outils de reporting pour Rolex, Tudor et leurs filiales tout en animant la communaut√© de Business Intelligence Self-Service.

Responsabilit√©s


Participer √† la conception des outils de reporting
D√©velopper les tableaux de bord et outils d‚Äôanalyse de donn√©es
D√©finir et r√©aliser les flux d‚Äôalimentation de donn√©es du Data Warehouse
Optimiser les sources de donn√©es pour une bonne exp√©rience utilisateur
Orienter les √©volutions des Data Warehouses et des outils de visualisation de donn√©es
Promouvoir l‚Äôutilisation des outils self-service BI dans la communaut√© via des communications et des formations
Apporter le support niveau 3 sur les outils de reporting
Maitriser l‚Äôarchitecture technique des environnements BI et la faire √©voluer avec les √©quipes Plateforme
G√©rer diff√©rents projets de d√©ploiement
Assurer une veille technologique dans les domaines de la BI


Profil

Title: Business Intelligence/ Data Analytics Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Born from a single question, innovation is in our DNA. Having recently celebrated our 10-year anniversary, we are a diverse and quality-conscious company, which has set itself the goal of transporting temperature-sensitive medicines in a more reliable and sustainable way. Long story short, we help save lives and preserve the environment.

Our goal? To continue to advance towards zero loss in the pharma supply chain, worldwide.

If you're a BI Data Analytics Analyst with strong skills in business intelligence tools and systems, KPI dashboard development and maintenance, trend analysis for actionable insights, financial planning support and data-driven decision-making - this could be the role for you:

Here's what you'll do:


Implement and Improvement of Business Intelligence Tools and systems
Implement, develop, and maintain of internal and external KPI Dashboards
Prepare reports and analyses in order to identify trends to generate actionable business insights
Support the Controlling/Financial Planning and Analysis team
Support the other departments with data insights
Maintain of the Business Intelligence tool and EPM
Act as sparring Partner for the Finance Team, CFO, Deputy CFO and the Management team
Participate in interdisciplinary projects



Requirements

This is what you'll need:


Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics & Presentation, combined with Business/Finance or equivalent
Several years of practical experience in Business Intelligence, AI, Data Mining, Data analytics, and Data Modeling, ERP/EPM projects either from a consultancy or an industry position in international growth/scale-up environments
Proven experience with data modelling, business intelligence tools and systems
Excellent knowledge of data analysis and visualization tools like Excel, SAP Business Analytics, Power BI, SQL, etc
IT Project Management and implementation experience
Ability to convert complex data into clear, concise reports and presentations
Interest in figures, business contexts, data, numbers, research, and analysis
Ability to manage several tasks in detail and accuracy, without loosing the overview
Result-oriented with a focus on long-term goals and career growth
Fluent in English and German



Benefits

What we can offer you:


Flexible working hours for work/life balance
Interdisciplinary and varied projects
Diverse and global work culture/ environment
Possibility to work for an environmentally conscious company
Unique opportunity to actively shape processes



Why SkyCell:

We are looking for people who challenge the status quo and thrive on making a difference to people and the world around us. That's where our Finance & Admin team play a pivotal role and you could be a part of it.

Our Group Controlling & Finance Department is at the heart of our strategic decision-making process. We analyze financial data to provide strategic insights and support decision-making as well as develop and implement financial strategies to optimize our resources. Our team is not just about crunching numbers; we're about shaping the future of SkyCell AG. We work closely with senior leadership to drive growth, profitability, and sustainability.

We are Innovative Award Winners:

We're driven by our core values and guided by our collaborations, purpose, and employees. Our commitment to changing the face of medical supply chains, making them safer, more secure, and more sustainable resonates strongly with every one of our employees; we're therefore incredibly proud to have been certified as a Great Place to Work alongside being awarded a sustainability rating of Platinum by EcoVadis.

If you would like to know more about us, visit www.skycell.ch and search #WeAreSkyCell on LinkedIn.

To become part of our journey and make a difference - click apply and we will be in touch!

Please contact Lucy Slough, Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist if you have any questions (hr@skycell.ch).

SkyCell AG is proud to be an equal opportunities employer, we celebrate and support diversity and are passionate about creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, colour, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics.

For this position we only consider direct applications

Title: Data Analyst - Metals
Description:
Job Description: Data Analyst ‚Äì Metals Sector




We are looking for an ambitious data analyst who is passionate about sustainability and data-driven business. In this role, you will work with ecoinvent users and data providers to enhance the metals sector of the ecoinvent database.




Responsibilities:

Provide technical support for diverse projects aimed at improving and developing the core structure of the ecoinvent database and the expansion of its coverage, including:

Desk research tasks, deep dives into metal production processes, and providing analyses to the sector manager.

Reviewing datasets for data provision projects.

Collaborate with external stakeholders, such as data providers, to guide them through the data preparation and submission process.
Support the communication efforts of ecoinvent, reinforcing support for users of the ecoinvent database.




Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs Degree in Mining, Metallurgy, or a related field a must.
Preferably a minimum of one year of industry experience in mining, metal processing, or a related field
Experience in LCA, practical or theoretical, and the ecoinvent methodology and data is a plus.
Proficiency in English; any other language is an asset.
Proficiency in MS Office.
Basic programming skills, especially in Python.
Basic modeling skills.
Self-motivated attitude, systematic thinking, and strong attention to detail.

The ideal candidate brings strong critical thinking skills and a problem-solving attitude. You are proactive, structured, and organized. You are enthusiastic about learning and pushing for innovation. You will work independently and alongside internal and external collaborators, so good interpersonal skills, effective communication skills, and a can-do attitude are essential. Managing multiple, diverse tasks simultaneously does not phase you. You enjoy working in a diverse and international team, have a curious mind, and grasp new concepts quickly.




Why ecoinvent?

As a fast-growing team based in Z√ºrich with over twenty nationalities, we embrace diversity and promote a collaborative and adventurous mindset. We are committed to building an inspiring work culture that nurtures creative thinking, transparency, and reliability.




Our benefits include flexible and hybrid work, employee professional growth plans, and our most vital asset: our community. We value transparency, flexibility, and a diverse working environment that encourages learning and continuous improvement. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do. Join us and make an impact.




Our Mission

ecoinvent is an internationally active, mission-driven organization devoted to supporting high-quality, science-based environmental assessments. Its activities include publishing and maintaining the ecoinvent database‚Äîa comprehensive life cycle inventory database that provides reliable and transparent information on the environmental impacts of various products and services. It is used by companies, researchers, and policymakers to analyze the environmental impacts of their operations and make informed decisions.




Interested in this unique opportunity?

Please submit your complete application through our LinkedIn posting, including your CV and possible start date.




Please note that immigration sponsorship is not possible for this role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Data Analyst role involves collecting, processing, and analysing data to help us make informed decisions. You will be responsible for interpreting data sets, performing statistical analyses to identify trends, and developing data models to predict future outcomes. The analyst will work closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs, ensuring accurate and accessible reporting. You should possess strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to communicate complex findings in a clear and understandable manner. This position requires a blend of technical expertise and business acumen to contribute to data-driven strategies that drive the organization's goals forward.

Responsibilities

Primary Responsibilities:



Support operational analysis component of the Tenerity business
Build automated reporting processes to minimize manual effort
Collaborate with key business stakeholders (Acquisition, Performance Marketing, Billing, and Finance) to identify opportunities where data science can drive value, improve processes, and generate actionable insights.
Communicate complex technical concepts and findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Act as a data expert to support account teams in answering questions and queries



Qualifications

Qualifications:



Bachelor or Master‚Äôs degree, preferably in Analytics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, Data Science
1-2+ years proven experience
Competencies in utilizing SQL for data retrieval and analysis
Other coding languages are a plus ( SAS, R, Python, etc.)
Strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities
Ability to interpret data effectively to provide insight for strategic partnerships
Skillful in Microsoft applications with advanced Excel exposure (ex. v-lookups, pivot tables, VB macro scripting, etc.)
Experience in Amazon QuickSight is a plus
Ability to work on multiple projects and tasks simultaneously
Effective verbal and written communication skills, including ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders
Fluent in English, French or other languages are a plus
Strong time management skills
Ability to adapt to challenging situations
Ability to work in a multicultural environment
Strong stakeholders management skills

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF 300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.




With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide

advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.




‚ÄúRethink Everything‚Äù is our philosophy ‚Äì it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.




Our technology team works directly and closely with the Business. Our IT ecosystem is based on state-of-the-art tools from leading financial software providers. In addition to this, we develop our own solutions using agile development and DevOps techniques.




In order to strengthen our Asset Management - IT team, we are looking for a Geneva based:




Business Intelligence Analyst ‚Äì Temporary (6 months)




Primary responsibilities




Migrate manual process (excel) into automated Alteryx workflows & Tableau dashboards
Drive collaboration with various units to optimize and streamline their operational workflows
Provide guidance and support to business users in utilizing our Business intelligence for self-service analytics and reporting




Desired profile




University degree in finance, information technology or equivalent
Knowledge of Business Intelligence platforms ‚Äì Tableau & Alteryx is preferred
Team player with strong communication skills
Quick learner with strong problem-solving skills




Why join us




Our Maison‚Äôs DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.




LOIM is an equal opportunity employer

HTML:
A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF 300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.


With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide

advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.


‚ÄúRethink Everything‚Äù is our philosophy ‚Äì it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.


Our technology team works directly and closely with the Business. Our IT ecosystem is based on state-of-the-art tools from leading financial software providers. In addition to this, we develop our own solutions using agile development and DevOps techniques.


In order to strengthen our Asset Management - IT team, we are looking for a Geneva based:


Business Intelligence Analyst ‚Äì Temporary (6 months)


Primary responsibilities


  • Migrate manual process (excel) into automated Alteryx workflows & Tableau dashboards
  • Drive collaboration with various units to optimize and streamline their operational workflows
  • Provide guidance and support to business users in utilizing our Business intelligence for self-service analytics and reporting


Desired profile


  • University degree in finance, information technology or equivalent
  • Knowledge of Business Intelligence platforms ‚Äì Tableau & Alteryx is preferred
  • Team player with strong communication skills
  • Quick learner with strong problem-solving skills


Why join us


Our Maison‚Äôs DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.


LOIM is an equal opportunity employer


We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment, where talented people inspire the organization with a diversity of thought, background, experience and identity to reinforce our innovation and deliver excellence. We firmly believe this is how we will continue to thrive. To deliver on this, we have actively embedded Diversity & Inclusion in our business strategy.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Data Analyst role involves collecting, processing, and analysing data to help us make informed decisions. You will be responsible for interpreting data sets, performing statistical analyses to identify trends, and developing data models to predict future outcomes. The analyst will work closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs, ensuring accurate and accessible reporting. You should possess strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to communicate complex findings in a clear and understandable manner. This position requires a blend of technical expertise and business acumen to contribute to data-driven strategies that drive the organization's goals forward.

¬†

Primary Responsibilities:

Support operational analysis component of the Tenerity business
Build automated reporting processes to minimize manual effort
Collaborate with key business stakeholders (Acquisition, Performance Marketing, Billing, and Finance) to identify opportunities where data science can drive value, improve processes, and generate actionable insights.
Communicate complex technical concepts and findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Act as a data expert to support account teams in answering questions and queries

¬†

¬†

Qualifications:

Bachelor or Master‚Äôs degree, preferably in Analytics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, Data Science
1-2+ years proven experience
Competencies in utilizing SQL for data retrieval and analysis
Other coding languages are a plus (SAS, R, Python, etc.)
Strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities
Ability to interpret data effectively to provide insight for strategic partnerships
Skillful in Microsoft applications with advanced Excel exposure (ex. v-lookups, pivot tables, VB macro scripting, etc.)
Experience in Amazon QuickSight is a plus
Ability to work on multiple projects and tasks simultaneously
Effective verbal and written communication skills, including ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders
Fluent in English, French or other languages are a plus
Strong time management skills
Ability to adapt to challenging situations
Ability to work in a multicultural environment
Strong stakeholders management skills

¬†

Title: Consumer Insights & Data Analyst Specialist
Description:
PricingOne is a consulting firm with a start-up mindset specialized in Revenue Growth Management and Pricing Strategies for Consumer-Packaged Goods (CPG/FMCG) companies to ‚Äúunlock growth where others can‚Äôt‚Äù. We deliver a unique consumer-centric approach to Revenue Growth Management (RGM), combining a proven cutting-edge methodology, powered by a highly experienced team. You will be joining a highly dynamic and growing company, working across more than 20 countries over 5 continents. Come learn and contribute to the development of PricingOne. For more information, please visit www.pricing.one.




MAIN PURPOSE




You will be a key member of our team of expert business partners, part of the Production department (Analytics/Insights/BI) located in Geneva. You will work closely with a team of experts and analysts on several projects and will report to the Production VP. You will help deliver expert business analysis and recommendations to PricingOne clients. Your role will be to explore and analyze client data on sales performance, consumer behavior, trade and pricing response, design and supervise consumer and market research to guide business and pricing recommendations. You will leverage statistical and analytical tools available to you to also conduct scenario and simulations. You will be accountable for delivering on the assigned project tasks and milestones.




YOUR PROFILE




With a business, commercial, or marketing background, you are a specialist in analyzing and interpreting data and are able to articulate insights into actionable recommendations. You have an outstanding expertise in market research and a fundamental understanding of the clients' needs regarding marketing, pricing and portfolio growth. You are committed and always work with integrity. You are a team player and bring strong analytical and presentation skills plus creativity and enthusiasm to your work and to everything you do. Highly organized and efficient with the ability to work on their own initiative and meet multiple deadlines.




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES




Defining quantitative methods to be used by agencies and ‚Äúoutside-the-box‚Äù thinking to help answer complex business questions.

Manage all phases of a market research study except for programming & modeling: questionnaire design, fieldwork management (no actual coordination with fieldwork agencies), data analysis, preparation of reports and presentations in line with strategic business issues.
Manage various data sources (e.g.: Trade panel, Consumer panel, P&L, Promotion calendars, etc.) to build the appropriate database
Leverage several sources of data to analyze general as well as specific trends, year-over-year sales, key regional and product differences including relevant competitive information
Consulting clients on their business issues to help optimize marketing communication, product pricing and portfolios, and new product developments.
Ensuring good and efficient collaboration with third-party agencies in different countries.
Independent management of client contact during day-to-day project management.
Ensuring that the assigned projects are optimally carried out and deadlines are met.




KEY REQUIREMENTS




Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Statistics or in a related field. A Master‚Äôs degree in business administration, market research, marketing life sciences, sociology or psychology will be advantageous.
Minimum of >5-10 years of relevant work experience (Market Research, Business analysis in agencies or in B2C CPG/FMCG industry), ideally with good knowledge of the Swiss market.
Strong Project Management skills are mandatory.
Exposure to various quantitative/qualitative market research methodologies; knowledge of conjoint (Choice-Based Conjoint) analysis is a plus.
Experience in analyzing pricing elasticities, promotion effectiveness, forecasting consumption, user flows, revenue and market shares using retail panel data (e.g.: Nielsen, IRI, etc).
Interest in data management.
Have developed Business Awareness in consulting clients on their challenges.
Entrepreneurial and pro-active attitude.
Eye for details.
Strong analytical and communication skills
Keen interest in talking to clients of leading companies and consulting them on their business challenges.
Ability to perform independent research to solve problems.
Ability to thrive while working on multiple projects.
Ability to work well across teams but also independently.
Strong knowledge of Excel (pivots), Word, and PowerPoint.
SQL, Power BI and VBA/macros experience is a plus.
Excellent written and oral communication skills in English
French or German is a plus




WHY WORK FOR PRICINGONE




Large variety of tasks and projects that will enhance both your soft and hard skills.

Wonderful international & multi-cultural team to work with.

Amazing development opportunity in excellent business environment with passionate experts.

Networking opportunities across the industry, at senior leadership level.

We offer real work assignments that come as ideal education complement.

Flexible hours.

Show more

Title: Group HR Data Analyst
Description:
What Makes You, Makes Zegna

As part of a wider HR transformation program, Ermenegildo Zegna Group is in the process of standardizing and harmonizing its HR systems and services. We are looking for an HR Data Analyst, who will be working with diverse internal stakeholders and external partners across the globe. A proactive actor in multiple projects covering the main responsibility for data analysis and data maintenance. Within the more relevant projects, the resource will be mainly involved in the multi-years HRIS Oracle Human Capital Management implementation and in the Segregation of Duties governance defining and monitoring that systems authorities/access rights in the company are granted and used in accordance with the Group‚Äôs Job Architecture and the individuals‚Äô role/span of control.

The job location is Stabio, Switzerland.

Main Responsibilities


Act as an active contributor of the Group Organization & Change Management team in aligning and executing the HR Technology roadmap with business needs.
As IT counterpart of the HR Department, be in constant contact with the business to understand their requirements and help optimize all HR-IT applications including HRIS (Oracle HCM), E-Signature application (DocuSign), Learning Platform LMS (Moodle) etc.
Play a crucial role within the design of standard processes, to be rolled out globally at a later stage.
Update/create Job Roles and other systems dimension to guarantee a constant alignment on the HRIS.
Develop and maintain documentation, training materials and user guides for HR processes and systems
Act in partnership with IT and Internal Audit teams in defining and maintaining a Segregation of duties model according to the new Group Job Architecture.
Support HR representation in accelerating Corporate Sustainability strategy and programs and assist with HR data for survey completion.
Guarantee constant support to the Group HR worldwide teams in terms of functional HR systems usage
Deliver systems training when needed
Execute regular HRIS data audit and cleansing


Here are some experiences/skills that we are looking for:


Proficient English knowledge
Minimum 3/4 years of professional experience in HR Department (Organization, HRIS), preferably in international HR projects with specific focus on SOD
Degree in Business Administration, (business) Informatics, (business) Engineering, Psychology, or similar
Professional background in HR IT in an international corporate environment or at consulting company
MSOffice proficiency
Oracle HCM knowledge is strongly appreciated
Process management
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Passion for providing quality, security and accuracy
Very good analytical skills
Excellent communication skills to address all levels within the HR and other departments, including presentation and training skills
Able to handle multiple deadlines and stakeholders
Availability to travel
Show more

Title: (Junior-) Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Arrakis aims to disrupt the current market-making industry by providing the infrastructure to enable every project in the world that wants to launch a token to benefit from non-custodial, trust-less, and automated on-chain market-making strategies. We believe in a world where every organization, from a small startup to a large enterprise, will be tokenized and traded on-chain. For this world, Arrakis is building the tools to create the necessary liquidity to enable this token economy to rival and out-compete the traditional financial industry.

As a Quantitative Analyst at Arrakis, you will drive our liquidity provisioning strategies, develop quantitative analyses of on-chain trading activities and own client relationships to deliver tailored market-making services. You'll also work with our business development team on client onboarding, account management and enhance our quantitative algorithms with the core development team. Your contributions will be vital in establishing Arrakis as the leading decentralised market-making protocol.

What You'll Accomplish


Working with some of the leading DeFi projects in web3 to strengthen their on-chain liquidity
Keep ahead of the latest developments in quantitative finance, blockchain technology, and Web3 innovations to continuously refine and adapt our market making strategies (e.g. upcoming migration to UniswapV4) to maintain a competitive edge in the rapidly evolving web3 market-making industry
Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with software engineers, data scientists and business development representatives to refine, enhance and develop the best market making service to our clients
Own customer relationships and provide excellent client service by monitoring the ongoing market-making activities and respond to custom client requests
Perform data analysis and design Analytics dashboards with on-chain data



Requirements

Our ideal candidate has:


At least 2 years professional experience in Trading, Quantitative Finance, Market Making (preferred)
Experience in Quantitative analysis and Data Science preferably on-chain data / DeFi
Web3 native using DeFi protocols every day/week
Experience working with JavaScript / TypeScript, SQL
Bonus: Rust, Dune Analytics
Some experience with hands on software development in a quantitative finance environment
Comfortable in fast-paced environments and having ambitious targets
Excellent communication skills being able to engage in client relationship management and communication
Well-organised with strong time management skills and a proactive personality
Bonus: Experience working in a successful DeFi protocol



Benefits

Join an amazing team of industry veterans focused on revolutionising web3 market making, collaborating with major projects like MakerDAO, Uniswap, Aave, Lido, operating fully remotely with members spanning Zug, Paris, New York, Berlin supported by world-class investors including Uniswap Labs, Robot Ventures, Accel, Longhash, and more.

What we offer:


Competitive salary
SPICE token package
Work remotely or with the Founders in person, in Switzerland
Chance to travel the world to go to exciting events, connecting with key industry players
Join amazing in-person offsites all over the world
Show more

Title: BI Data Analyst ‚Äì Z√ºrich
Description:
Job Description

Apply now for the position BI Data Analyst ‚Äì Z√ºrich and let‚Äôs achieve great things together! Become part of a successful team and achieve success beyond your previous capabilities. Hungry for more? Properti is the leading and multi-award-winning PropTech broker in Switzerland. We combine highly trained experts with the latest technologies on an intelligent platform to provide customers, brokers and service partners with risk-free, flexible and simplified services. If you can imagine working at Technology in Z√ºrich, apply now for the position.

Tasks


Collecting and analyzing data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and correlations that will support business growth
Creating and maintaining data models, databases, and central dashboards to support data-driven decision-making
Collaborating with stakeholders and data scientists to establish business goals, metrics, and requirements and then translate these specifics into business analysis solutions
Conducting data quality checks while ensuring data integrity and accuracy across all spectrums before implementing findings
Developing reports, visualizations, and presentations to communicate strategic findings and presenting these insights as recommendations to key stakeholders to aid business decisions
Identifying opportunities for process improvements and optimization based on data insights


Job requirements


A Bachelor‚Äôs degree (or Master‚Äôs degree) in a field such as data analytics, statistics, business administration, mathematics, computer science, data science or a related discipline is preferred
A minimum of 3-5 years of experience in data analysis, information technology, or a related field of data management
Strong technical skills in data collection, data mining, and statistical modeling techniques
Work experience with programming languages and tools such as SQL, Python, R and simple analytics tools such as Excel
Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView to create compelling visualizations and reports
Understanding of database concepts such as database structures, query languages, and data warehousing principles
Experience handling business intelligence tools such as Microsoft Power BI, Oracle Business Intelligence, IBM Cognos to extract and analyze data
Experience with information systems in the context of machine learning, big data, or AI is a strong advantage
Commitment to continuous learning and willingness to stay updated on emerging industry trends, business processes, technologies, and methodologies in the data field
Strong analytical skills: You are able to break down complex problems in a data analyst role, analyze data effectively, and derive meaningful insights are all keys to success in this role
Attention to detail: You must be meticulous and thorough throughout the data analysis process, ensuring accuracy in reporting and recommendations
Critical thinking: You use strategic thinking to evaluate information objectively and assess alternative solutions to make informed decisions
Effective communication skills: Your ability to convey complex technical terms to non-technical team members is an essential part of the role, communicating findings in a clear and concise manner
Collaboration and teamwork: You‚Äôre a team player, always willing to work with cross-functional and global teams, share knowledge, and contribute to collective goals
Problem-solving skills: You can identify and define problems, analyze root causes, and develop innovative solutions based on strategic insights
Project management: You are able to coordinate complex projects beyond the scope of business analytics, ensuring timely roll-out and consistently meeting goals and expectations


Job advantages


Promotion: above-average career opportunities & talent promotion
Doer mentality: young and innovative company, embedded in an agile, flat entrepreneurial culture
Properti Academy: access to our internal academy in the field of real estate
Properti Coaching: internal professional contact point with own psychologist
Modern working environment: flexible working hours with the possibility of home office
Food & Drinks: fresh fruits & snacks, coffee & tea, drinks & after work beer
Birthday Retreat: half day free of charge
Loyalty: 5 weeks vacation, plus unlimited (unpaid) vacations
Teambuilding: Rocket Friday, summer & winter event, incentive trips

Title: Procurement Data Analyst
Description:
CONTEXT

Richemont is looking for a Procurement Data Analyst to reinforce the existing Team and increase global compliance in the Procure to Pay process while optimising sourcing activities across the Group.

In this role, you will support Procurement teams on the implementation of data processes, as well as on the development of actionable reporting and analyses to monitor performance and compliance indicators.

Furthermore, you will contribute to key topics in the management of Richemont‚Äôs supplier base, spend analysis and sustainability.

Smart leverage of data is key to the understanding of our supply chains and to drive meaningful actions. Through advanced data analytics and stakeholders‚Äô collaboration, you will help the procurement community achieve greater results!

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?


Build meaningful and actionable dashboards for the Procurement community
Analyse and track compliance to internal purchasing policies
Contribute to a better understanding of Richemont‚Äôs spend and supplier base
Accompany business users in their data journey


WHAT DO YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE?


You have a Bachelor or Master‚Äôs degree in science or engineering or equivalent
You are curious, detail-oriented and perseverant
You are analytical and enjoy looking for creative solutions to technical and business problems
You are collaborative and can work with a non-technical community
You know the basics of programming and are proficient in Microsoft Excel and SQL
You are fluent in English, proficiency in French is a plus


WHAT MAKES OUR GROUP DIFFERENT?

Our true power does not lie in our similarities but in the rich diversity of our arts, cultures, and human skills, as well as our specific ability to foster untapped potential.


We value freedom, collegiality, loyalty, and solidarity
We foster empathy, curiosity, courage, humility, and integrity
We care for the world we live in

Title: HR Reporting & Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title:

HR Reporting & Data Analyst

Contract Type:

Time Type:

Full time

Job Description:

The HR Reporting & Data Analyst will be responsible to develop, enhance, implement and maintain reporting capabilities across the different HR systems by using a wide range of reporting tools and techniques. The analyst will provide value adding analysis and commentary derived from key metrics, to highlight what is happening with our people to inform future people strategies.

Reporting to the Reward & HRIS Manager, the jobholder will interact with other system administrators, internal data integrity partners and will closely collaborate with stakeholders across the HR team and the wider business.

We are looking for an enthusiastic and hard-working person to join us as HR Reporting & Data Analyst and help our organization optimize their People Analytics in order to have the best in class analytical solutions. This role is for someone who has a very good knowledge of Workday reporting and a working experience in other analytical tools, ideally in a fast-paced environment, has a passion for data and analysis as well as for innovative technical solutions. This is an opportunity to expand your knowledge across the Workday Suite.

Main Responsilibities


Collaborate to the People Analytics strategy
Work collaboratively with stakeholders across the HR team and the wider business to understand their reporting needs. Suggest best in class analytical practices and provide them potential new insights and trend analysis based on their requirements.
Understand, manipulate, and present numerical data in formats that are easily understood by the stakeholders. Develop and maintain complex HR reports & metrics using data from multiple HR data sources.
Interprete, analyse and monitor trends in data, as directed by the HRIS Manager or by the business.
Own the Data Architecture in Workday and in other HR systems to ensure consistency amongst the different systems.
Responsible for Data Management in Workday and in other HR systems: ensure appropriate configuration documentation, end-users guidelines and trainings are in place for the different stakeholders.
Responsible for Data Audit in Workday and in other HR systems: ensure appropriate monthly controls are in place and coordinate different stakeholders for any corrections to be performed.



HCM Workday Reporting


Develop, enhance, implement and maintain Workday reporting capabilities, using the full suite of Workday Reporting tools (standard & advanced reports, composite reports, dashboards, worksheets and Discovery Boards).
Ensure data governance standards are implemented consistently, granting access to Workday reports in compliance with the existing security matrix and with relevant data protection regulations such as GDPR.
Provide training and support for Workday reporting functionalities, facilitating training sessions for HR professionals and other stakeholders.
Monitor and maintain data accuracy within Workday by building relevant reports and conducting regular audits of key information
Troubleshoote any issues.
Document report/dashboard requirements, their configuration and the relevant end-users guides.
Staying up to date on Workday new releases and changes related to reporting, analysing the changes impact on existing reporting, identifying improvement opportunities and promoting new releases to stakeholders and users.



Reporting


Develop, enhance and maintain HR reports & metrics in different tools (Excel, Power BI, ‚Ä¶) using data from multiple HR data sources.
Ensure data governance standards are respected.
Produce BAU reporting and analytics for the HR professionals and the wider business.
Produce ad hoc regional and global reports and analytics as requested by stakeholders and business need, e.g producing data for local management meetings, board meetings, external surveys, audits, ‚Ä¶
Strong presentation skills in line with firm branding, including presenting information through PowerBI, Excel and PowerPoint.
Ad hoc administrative tasks in relation to data and analytics (maintenance of reports catalogue, data policy and guidance, ‚Ä¶).
Be involved in data modelling for compensation campaigns.
Contribute to HR Projects through discussion of how HR technology can be leveraged to deliver the outcome, gathering requirements for future use.
Performs other duties as required.



If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

Our people make all the difference in our success.

Job Title:

HR Reporting & Data Analyst

Contract Type:

Time Type:

Full time

Job Description:

The HR Reporting & Data Analyst will be responsible to develop, enhance, implement and maintain reporting capabilities across the different HR systems by using a wide range of reporting tools and techniques. The analyst will provide value adding analysis and commentary derived from key metrics, to highlight what is happening with our people to inform future people strategies.

Reporting to the Reward & HRIS Manager, the jobholder will interact with other system administrators, internal data integrity partners and will closely collaborate with stakeholders across the HR team and the wider business.

We are looking for an enthusiastic and hard-working person to join us as HR Reporting & Data Analyst and help our organization optimize their People Analytics in order to have the best in class analytical solutions. This role is for someone who has a very good knowledge of Workday reporting and a working experience in other analytical tools, ideally in a fast-paced environment, has a passion for data and analysis as well as for innovative technical solutions. This is an opportunity to expand your knowledge across the Workday Suite.

Main Responsilibities

  • Collaborate to the People Analytics strategy
  • Work collaboratively with stakeholders across the HR team and the wider business to understand their reporting needs. Suggest best in class analytical practices and provide them potential new insights and trend analysis based on their requirements.
  • Understand, manipulate, and present numerical data in formats that are easily understood by the stakeholders. Develop and maintain complex HR reports & metrics using data from multiple HR data sources.
  • Interprete, analyse and monitor trends in data, as directed by the HRIS Manager or by the business.
  • Own the Data Architecture in Workday and in other HR systems to ensure consistency amongst the different systems.
  • Responsible for Data Management in Workday and in other HR systems: ensure appropriate configuration documentation, end-users guidelines and trainings are in place for the different stakeholders.
  • Responsible for Data Audit in Workday and in other HR systems: ensure appropriate monthly controls are in place and coordinate different stakeholders for any corrections to be performed.


HCM Workday Reporting

  • Develop, enhance, implement and maintain Workday reporting capabilities, using the full suite of Workday Reporting tools (standard & advanced reports, composite reports, dashboards, worksheets and Discovery Boards).
  • Ensure data governance standards are implemented consistently, granting access to Workday reports in compliance with the existing security matrix and with relevant data protection regulations such as GDPR.
  • Provide training and support for Workday reporting functionalities, facilitating training sessions for HR professionals and other stakeholders.
  • Monitor and maintain data accuracy within Workday by building relevant reports and conducting regular audits of key information
  • Troubleshoote any issues.
  • Document report/dashboard requirements, their configuration and the relevant end-users guides.
  • Staying up to date on Workday new releases and changes related to reporting, analysing the changes impact on existing reporting, identifying improvement opportunities and promoting new releases to stakeholders and users.


Reporting

  • Develop, enhance and maintain HR reports & metrics in different tools (Excel, Power BI, ‚Ä¶) using data from multiple HR data sources.
  • Ensure data governance standards are respected.
  • Produce BAU reporting and analytics for the HR professionals and the wider business.
  • Produce ad hoc regional and global reports and analytics as requested by stakeholders and business need, e.g producing data for local management meetings, board meetings, external surveys, audits, ‚Ä¶
  • Strong presentation skills in line with firm branding, including presenting information through PowerBI, Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Ad hoc administrative tasks in relation to data and analytics (maintenance of reports catalogue, data policy and guidance, ‚Ä¶).
  • Be involved in data modelling for compensation campaigns.
  • Contribute to HR Projects through discussion of how HR technology can be leveraged to deliver the outcome, gathering requirements for future use.
  • Performs other duties as required.
