Title: Databricks, Power BI Consultant
Description:
To join our team dedicated to our Reinsurance, Insurance and Banking customers, we are looking for a Databricks, Power BI Consultant (F/M).




Your Responsibilities:

Analyze and interpret complex data to provide actionable insights.
Develop and implement advanced data models and algorithms to solve business problems.
Utilize Databricks for data processing, machine learning, and advanced analytics.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI to visualize key metrics and trends.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and develop data-driven solutions.
Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data science.

Your Profile:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience in the Reinsurance, Insurance and Banking.
Strong expertise in Databricks, including data processing, machine learning, and advanced analytics.
Proficient in Power BI for creating interactive dashboards and reports.
Strong programming skills in Python, R, or similar languages.
Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or similar.
Knowledge of statistical modeling and machine learning techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
Certification in Databricks, Power BI is a plus.

Title: Senior Data Analyst 100% (m/f/d)
Description:
Curaden AG, headquartered in Kriens near Lucerne, is an innovative family business and stands for an idea, for a system, for a philosophy in terms of comprehensive oral health. Better health for you - with this central promise, we develop, market and distribute products for dentistry and dental care worldwide under the brand CURAPROX. With this brand, we are now represented in over 90 countries on six continents.

In addition, we have been advising dental professionals in practices and laboratories with solutions for sixty years and offer all the necessary products for customer-oriented practice operations. Our goal is to create a win-win-win situation between patient-dentist-Curaden.

We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join our Digital Sales Department. This department oversees the company‚Äôs online distribution channels and mobile applications. The primary objective of this role is to utilise data to steer strategic decision-making and enhance business performance while establishing robust reporting systems and processes. Your focus will be to offer actionable insights that optimise the performance of our digital solutions by harnessing the power of data and transforming it into strategic insight to further refine these solutions. In this capacity, you will supervise one individual. This role is pivotal in monitoring and reporting on key metrics, facilitating data-informed decision-making, and contributing to the overall success and expansion of our digital solutions and activities. We expect from this position to enhance visibility into performance, improve the ability to identify optimization and growth opportunities, increase effectiveness in driving continuous improvement, and provide better insights into the profitability of our activities.

Senior Data Analyst 100% (m/f/d)

Lead a subteam and improve operations and performance of the team responsible for providing insights from digital data.Take ownership of the pipeline of data and analytics use cases across the digital products managed by the team.Establish and monitor use case value delivery and KPIs and regularly review performance with key stakeholders.Translate business inquiries into analytical solutions and use cases that produce actionable insights.Define data requirements, data models, and data architecture to support further analysis.Lead and conduct advanced data analysis to derive meaningful insights and guide strategic decision-making.Apply statistical techniques, predictive modeling, and machine learning algorithms to extract insights, foster innovation, and optimize business performance.Provide strategic guidance and actionable recommendations to stakeholders based on data insights.Present data-driven insights and recommendations to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.Ensure compliance with data protection regulations, privacy laws, and industry standards in data management and analytics activities.Collaborate with legal and compliance teams to address any data-related legal and ethical considerations.Develop and implement data management strategies, including data governance, data quality, and data integration, to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data.Cultivate a collaborative and innovative team culture, promoting knowledge sharing and continuous learning.Your profile

Hold a Bachelor of Science (or equivalent) in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Management Information Systems, IT, MBA, or possess equivalent commercial experience and discipline.Demonstrated leadership experience, with the ability to motivate and guide teams.Demonstrate extensive experience (preferably in healthcare) with relevant working knowledge in delivering actionable analytical insights that drive positive business results.Possess strategic business acumen and understanding of commercial and marketing approaches.Exhibit proficiency in analytical methods, statistical models and tools, and hypothesis building.Have the ability to communicate and collaborate across business and technical teams, with empathy and sensitivity for differences in data maturity.Possess strong project and people management skills to execute complex initiatives and to get things done.Demonstrate the capacity to challenge the status quo and to be solutions oriented.Exhibit the ability to motivate key stakeholders from different teams to work towards the same goal.Possess experience in change management.Curaden convinces with

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
What We Offer


Interact with our clients on regular basis to drive their business towards impactful change.
Work in multidisciplinary teams and learn from motivated colleagues.
A chance to take responsibility for your work, develop yourself every day and take full ownership of your career.
Become part of a fast growing international and diverse team.



What You Will Do


Perform data analysis in the field of customer and product analytics, marketing analytics, and (Gen)AI solutions.
Conduct analyses in typical analytical tools ranging from SAS, SPSS, Eviews, R, Python, SQL, Teradata, Hadoop, Access, Excel, etc.
Communicate analyses via compelling presentations.
Solve problems, disaggregate issues, develop hypotheses and develop actionable recommendations from data and analysis.
Prepare and facilitating workshops.
Manage stakeholders and communicating with executives.



What You‚Äôll Bring


Bachelor or Master (or Ph.D.) degree in a quantitative field with a focus on data analysis (e.g. econometrics, AI, mathematics, physics, and other exact sciences).
0-3 years of professional experience in the analytics domain.
Good knowledge of statistical concepts, accompanied by expertise with a set of analytical tools ranging from databases (e.g. SQL, BigQuery, noSQL) to programming languages (e.g. R, Python), and from data visualization (e.g. PowerBI) to machine learning and AI.
Understanding data engineering solutions is a plus.
Good knowledge of Git & Docker.
Professional fluency in English required with (Swiss) German as a strong plus.



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
VF Corporation is looking for an exceptional Business Intelligence Analyst to join our BI EMEA team based in Stabio, Switzerland.




Let‚Äôs talk about the role!

As a BI Analyst, you have been already exposed to the BI subject matter, either at the University or in a first work experience. You will participate in the design and deployment of key strategic BI Solutions. You will support your Lead Manager in daily activities to ensure product adoption and contribute to the verification and continuous improvement of reporting data quality. Direct exposure to the end-user community is crucial in this role, as is an advanced ability to conceptualize and test solutions from source system to BI solutions.




Job Details




We expect you to deliver unbeatable results while fulfilling the following aspects of the BI Analyst role:

Gather and understand Business Requirements
Transform Business Requirements into Logical Data Models and high-level Technical Requirements
Communicate the gathered information with the technical team
Implement reports as a Superuser
Manage incidents and provide support to the Business Community in addressing their data/tools challenges




Skills For Success

To succeed as a BI Analyst, you must translate our business objectives into a coherent BI design, follow up with the implementation team, double-check the final deliverables, and follow-up their adoption in the Business Community. Strong empathy and influencing skills will help you get both the business and the technical team on board. We are looking for someone with a service-oriented approach who has:




An attitude of teamwork, aiding colleagues in resolving issues, and hastening your own learning curve about the technical landscape and business processes
A general understanding of Business Intelligence/Data Warehouse applications
Understanding of Data Modeling principles
Hands-on experience in data investigations
Experience with Visual Insight platforms (Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, IBM Cognos preferred)
Experience with relational data access (SAP HANA, SQL Server, Redshift‚Ä¶)
Exposure to Fashion/Retail industries in prior experiences is considered a plus
Knowledge of the main SAP GUI, back-end tables, and their interactions is considered a plus




Other key skills for success:




Teamwork attitude, good interaction, and communication skills
Ability to handle Change Management
Focus on the end-user community
Problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Analytical mindset
Ability to escalate to the appropriate level of support
Efficiency and effectiveness in dealing with end-users
Fluency in spoken and written English

We‚Äôre in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That‚Äôs why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we‚Äôre the total package.

An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together

Title: Digital Data Analyst (f/m/d) 80-100%
Description:
Join us in the top league!

We are the largest private telecommunications company in Switzerland and a subsidiary of Liberty Global. With Switzerland‚Äôs leading gigabit fiber optic network and one of the world‚Äôs best mobile networks, we are headed right to the very top. Our goal is clear: To become the national champion, pioneering the market. Future-oriented ways of working and workplaces make us one of the most attractive employers on the Swiss market.

Make the most of your talent: Get to know Sunrise right here!

The Digital Analytics team is seeking a passionate digital (web and app) data analyst to take on a role with real impact, shaping both the projects we undertake and our approach to them. As an exceptional analyst and advisor, you will regularly interact with Squad Leads in Sunrise‚Äôs Digital Department. Utilizing your business acumen, web/app analytics expertise, and communication skills, you will identify and quantify opportunities for initiatives and report on their progress and success.

Tasks


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data analysis needs, define KPIs and monitor performance; Work as strategic data advisor providing actionable insights
Monitor website & app traffic and analyze user behavior using Google Analytics, BigQuery and Looker Studio; Create scalable visualizations and reporting solutions that are actionable and drive business decisions
Provide ad-hoc analysis to identify root causes, trends and patterns in data to inform decisions
Ensure the accuracy, completeness, and validity of onsite (web and app) data; work closely with tracking/implementation developers
Conduct A/B tests and experiments to improve users conversion rates and engagement
Build documentation and training to help stakeholders self-serve and up-skill on topics related to digital analytics


Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics; or equivalent practical experience
4+ years of experience in digital analytics, preferably with Google Analytics; Tag Management and tracking implementation experience a plus
Strong knowledge of SQL and previous experience with data visualization tools (e.g.: Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI)
Experience conducting A/B tests and experiments to improve website performance and user engagement
Excellent analytical and business skills to refine solutions jointly with stakeholders
Extraordinary motivation and ability to plan and deliver projects reliably in a fast-paced environment
Fluency in written and oral English


At Sunrise, you will work in a dynamic and international environment where every voice is heard, perspectives are shared, and values are respected. We are an equal opportunity employer, with a diverse workforce, which is part of the success of our business. Sunrise has partnered with ¬´Advance Gender Equality in Business¬ª, is a recipient of the Swiss LGBTI-Label and is certified with the ¬´Fair-ON-Pay Advanced¬ª for providing equal pay for work of equal value to women and men.

In addition to our new ¬´FlexWork¬ª working model, we offer you above-average social benefits and attractive product advantages from the Sunrise range.

Seize this opportunity to join us on our journey to actively help shape our future!

Information for agencies: Application dossiers sent or uploaded by placement agencies, or the like are not desired and will therefore not be considered and deleted.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Profil du candidat

Your Profile


You are graduated from of a quantitative Master or an engineering school with majors in



Mathematics, Physics, Data Engineering or Quantitative Finance.


Experience in large IT projects using continuous integration tools such as TFS or AWS is a plus. You have worked in python or C++ and enjoy programming.
Good knowledge in time series analysis, machine learning, statistical models and data science would be a plus.
Previous experience on a trading floor or in the commodities market would be a plus but for sure curiosity and interest for our industry is essential.
You have good communication skills, a can-do attitude and proactively take initiatives
You know how to work in an evolving environment where pressure and urgency are daily occurrences.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees‚Äô fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation.

Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We will provide necessary accommodations upon request.

Activit√©s

What You Will Do

Location: Geneva

Desired start date: Q2 2024

You will be part of the FIT team, a team of 8 members with a front status, sitting on the trading floor. The FIT team is responsible for the development and delivery of models and digital tools for the trading desks. It is the entry point for all trading desks, whether they are physical or paper and works closely with the market analysis and risk departments. We cover a wide range of topics and among those:


option pricing models. What is the value a physical pipe or a Time Charter vessel that enable us to arbitrage different indexes? Is there any relationship between flat price options and options on crack?
blend optimizations. How can I link my existing tanks, upcoming purchases and sells, available molecules in the market in a single tool that can show me the best potential blends that meet the regulatory requirements?
arbitrage calculations. How can I view simply and quickly the potential arbitrages ranging from 5-6 origin points to 5-6 destination points, while correctly considering freight costs, travel time and forwardness of the deal?
credit risk monitoring. What is the potential risk I am taking when trading derivatives instruments with counterparts with which there is no CSA agreement? How can I measure the return on risk I am taking with these counterparts?
stat arb tools. Are there any interesting links between pipe pressure in the US and Heating Oil market? Is there a tool where I can automatically execute some lots in the market instead of passing them manually?
data manipulation. Is there a one place stop shop or a tool where I can do some correlation or market analysis studies? How can I hedge specific illiquid indexes?



The tools provided by the team are used on a daily basis by the traders and are maintained by FIT. The mastery of our architecture, general interest in IT issues and dedication to client‚Äôs needs is necessary for a successful experience in the team. The FIT team works therefore regularly with the IDS department and has a dedicated IDS-FO team working in close partnership with them. The main infrastructure challenges in the coming year are the switch of our current applications to the group cloud and the construction of a robust Cloud Data Warehouse.

The programming languages you will be working on are Python, C++ or VBA and the tools delivered to traders range from Excel spreadsheets to heavy web applications depending on the user‚Äôs needs.

FIT members are usually young, enthusiasts and eager to learn. After a successful passage in the team, depending on your appetite and opportunities, you may move to a ‚Äúquant on desk‚Äù position (working even more closely with the traders) or take a more central position in the team (working on more long term projects with higher impact on our infrastructure).

The trading floor is a high pace, challenging environment, requiring agility, sharpness and rigour. Good communication, teamwork, multi-tasking are also essential skills.

Contexte et environnement

Take your first steps into a fulfilling career and join our Front Innovation Team as a quantitative analyst.

Are you looking to grow your career in the vibrant world of energy trading?

Do you have an engineering or quantitative finance background with good programming skills?

If yes, we would love to see your profile!

To support TotalEnergies‚Äôs ambitions, the Front Innovation Tools team (FIT) is looking to hire their next quantitative analyst.

Our Culture

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a Data Engineer for one of our clients in the Aargau area.




In this role, you will be tasked with implementing data automation through ETL/ELT processes, creating technical specifications for standardized data integration, classifying and modeling data, working with SQL databases, generating BI reports, analyzing and evaluating data, and ensuring effective data management.




If you have completed studies in computer science, electrical engineering, or vocational training, have several years of experience in data management with ETL/ELT processes, possess strong knowledge of data modelling, visualization and reporting tools, and are fluent in both German and English, this opportunity is ideal for you!




If you are interested in this role, apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

Title: Data Management Analyst
Description:
For our client, a leading company in ophthalmology, we are looking for a new team member as a




Data Management Analyst




Duration: 1 year - extension is possible (to be discussed)

Department: Data Management

Location: Schaffhausen

Business Title: Data Management Analyst

Key Relationships: R&D, MS&T, Production, Production Planning, Supply Chain, Quality Management, Quality Systems, as well as external stakeholders




PURPOSE OF THE POSITION

Local point of contact and support function for business stakeholders from the areas of R&D, MS&T, Production, Production Planning, Supply Chain, Quality Management, Quality Systems, as well as external stakeholders, to ensure centralized data management at the site, in compliance with regulations.
Responsible for master data maintenance according to the applicable guidelines.
Local point of contact and support function for AGS business stakeholders from all areas to ensure centralized record management at the site, in compliance with regulations.
Responsible for managing the archiving management system and the archives, according to the applicable guidelines.
As the technical deputy of the Data Management Teamlead, responsible for ensuring and implementing global data management and records management processes at the site.
Acts as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) and in other roles during audits.




ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES




DATA MANAGEMENT

Main responsibility for the interfaces between R&D, MS&T, Production, Production Planning, Supply Chain, Quality Management, Quality Systems, as well as external stakeholders during process changes and new products.
Coordination of changes in production with the Supply Chain and Production departments and in consultation with the project manager / MS&T.
Ensuring compliance of documents and data.
Supporting projects, e.g., MS&T and R&D, by creating the necessary master data.
Ensuring master data maintenance (Lifecycle Management) in SAP & MII.
Participation and support in SAP ECC / MII system user management, super user management, trainer management, and training of SAP users.
Performing the role of GRC Training Manager.
Creation of BI reports/layouts and BI reporting user training.




RECORDS MANAGEMENT

Administration of the archiving management system, including user and access management.
Main responsibility for managing the archives according to the applicable guidelines.
Ensuring the archiving of, e.g., validation documents, relevance analyses, risk analyses.




OTHER ACTIVITIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Acts as Change Owner for changes in the area of data management and records management.
Participation and support of local and global projects.

Acts as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) and in other roles during audits.

Completed education in a technical or commercial field.
At least 3-5 years of professional experience in the medical technology or pharmaceutical industry.

Very good German skills, both written and spoken.

OTHER

Proficient in MS Office.

HTML:
For our client, a leading company in ophthalmology, we are looking for a new team member as a


Data Management Analyst


Duration: 1 year - extension is possible (to be discussed)

Department: Data Management

Location: Schaffhausen

Business Title: Data Management Analyst

Key Relationships: R&D, MS&T, Production, Production Planning, Supply Chain, Quality Management, Quality Systems, as well as external stakeholders


PURPOSE OF THE POSITION

  • Local point of contact and support function for business stakeholders from the areas of R&D, MS&T, Production, Production Planning, Supply Chain, Quality Management, Quality Systems, as well as external stakeholders, to ensure centralized data management at the site, in compliance with regulations.
  • Responsible for master data maintenance according to the applicable guidelines.
  • Local point of contact and support function for AGS business stakeholders from all areas to ensure centralized record management at the site, in compliance with regulations.
  • Responsible for managing the archiving management system and the archives, according to the applicable guidelines.
  • As the technical deputy of the Data Management Teamlead, responsible for ensuring and implementing global data management and records management processes at the site.
  • Acts as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) and in other roles during audits.


ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES


DATA MANAGEMENT

  • Main responsibility for the interfaces between R&D, MS&T, Production, Production Planning, Supply Chain, Quality Management, Quality Systems, as well as external stakeholders during process changes and new products.
  • Coordination of changes in production with the Supply Chain and Production departments and in consultation with the project manager / MS&T.
  • Ensuring compliance of documents and data.
  • Supporting projects, e.g., MS&T and R&D, by creating the necessary master data.
  • Ensuring master data maintenance (Lifecycle Management) in SAP & MII.
  • Participation and support in SAP ECC / MII system user management, super user management, trainer management, and training of SAP users.
  • Performing the role of GRC Training Manager.
  • Creation of BI reports/layouts and BI reporting user training.


RECORDS MANAGEMENT

  • Administration of the archiving management system, including user and access management.
  • Main responsibility for managing the archives according to the applicable guidelines.
  • Ensuring the archiving of, e.g., validation documents, relevance analyses, risk analyses.


OTHER ACTIVITIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Acts as a Certified Investigator for deviations in the area of data management and records management.
  • Acts as Change Owner for changes in the area of data management and records management.
  • Participation and support of local and global projects.
  • Participation in the CCB as SME for the area of data management & records management.
  • Acts as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) and in other roles during audits.


QUALIFICATION

  • Completed education in a technical or commercial field.
  • At least 3-5 years of professional experience in the medical technology or pharmaceutical industry.
  • Experience in the field of GMP (Good Manufacturing Practice).


LANGUAGE SKILLS

  • Very good German skills, both written and spoken.
  • Good English skills, both written and spoken.


OTHER

  • Proficient in MS Office.
  • Proficient in ERP systems: SAP & MII.
  • Trackwise system (CAPA/NCI and Change Control).


We look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
For our client, a leading company in the Pharma industry, we are currently looking for a Data Engineer experienced in data integration using warehouses, data lakes and database modeling.




General Information:




Start Date: 15.08.2024

End Date: 01.11.2024 - extension possible

Workplace: Basel (Remote/Home Office: partially remote, partially in Basel)

Workload: 100%

Tasks and Responsibilities:




Developing a robust light-weight framework for creating data products based on an existing prototype that extracts data from multiple sources and creates data visualizations as the output
Creating automated extraction and loading processes from key databases
Creating easy-to-maintain transformations using DBT
Enabling a data storage solution and consumption by users via API or GUI
Developing, maintaining and documenting a solid codebase that we can turn into a self-service framework




Your Profile:




Min. vocational training
3-6 years of experience in data and workflow engineering skills (ETL/ELT principles)
Experience with data integration using warehouses, data lakes and database modeling (Snowflake, Postgres etc.)
Experience with Python for data extraction scripts
Experience with SQL for data extraction from internal databases
Experience with PostgreSQL for persistence of final product data, AWS S3 as a staging layer, Gitlab for CI, task and code tracking
A passion for working in an environment with high urgency, and you love to spend most of your time writing code
Enjoying operational side of things, like managing cloud-based infrastructure, workflow orchestration (e.g. GitLab CI/CD) and containerization (e.g., Docker)
Interest in understanding biomedical or preclinical research data or have previously worked in a Pharma domain
Excellent communication skills in English




Nice to have:

DTB for data transformations

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Position Summary:

We are looking for candidates with hands on experience in Big Data or Cloud Technologies.




Must have technical Skills:

8+ Years of experience

Expertise and hands-on experience on Spark Data Frame, and Hadoop echo system components.

Good knowledge and hands-on experience of AWS and AWS Glue.

Good knowledge of HiveQL & SparkQL.

Good knowledge of Shell script & Java/scala/python.

Good knowledge of SQL.

Good knowledge of migration projects on Hadoop.

Good Knowledge of one of the Workflow engine like Oozie, Autosys.

Good knowledge of Agile Development.

Passionate about exploring new technologies.

Automation approach.




*Data Ingestion, Processing and Orchestration knowledge




About Impetus

Impetus Technologies is a digital engineering company.

We deliver expert services and products in cloud data engineering and analytics space to help large enterprises in their digital transformation journey /goals. Enabling an intelligent, data-driven future for our customers.

We solve Analytics, AI (Artificial Intelligence), and Cloud puzzle for fortune 500 companies to help drive innovation and growth for them.

Headquartered in Los Gatos, California, with offshore development centers. We also have office in Canada.

Year on Year we have grown more than 40% and have been we have been recognized as one of the best companies to work for.




Why Impetus?




Work on solving real-life business problems using next-generation technologies. The quality and content of the job you do here is exceptional and helps you learn and grow fast

Learn while you Grow - You continuously learn and upgrade your skills. Get hands on learning through our unique training and development program.

We are on a mission to enable 100% of our Engineers on cloud

We are growing exponentially and looking for more than 100% growth in 2024

We are a people first company, and our work culture is the primary reason ‚Ä¶why more than 25 % of our employees have been with us for more than ten years.

If you are looking for Career growth and stability, this is the place for you.

You will have the opportunity to work with the smartest brains who have been thought leaders/authors contributing to the tech world.

The mission of team is to enablethe companies scientists to access and work with research data generated during early lead identification and optimization campaigns.

The perfect candidate has 4 years of experience in data and workflow engineering. Additionally, the person is experienced in data integration using warehouses, data lakes and database modeling. Experience with Python and SQL is required. Lastly, the candidate communicates fluently in English.

Title: Data Analyst / Scientist
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst/Scientist to join our IoT Lab team, responsible for developing BOBST Connect, our all-in-one digital platform that enhances and improves packaging productivity. BOBST Connect brings data and digital services together in one fully connected cloud platform, with BOBST machine insights and expertise built-in, enabling overview and orchestration of the production process. You will be an integral part of the agile organization responsible for developing this innovative product, constantly evolving to serve our customers.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with our business stakeholders, IoT product management team, development teams, and other Data Scientists to define new products, services, and tools using data and machine learning. As a member of the team, you will work on the development of data models, algorithms, and statistical analyses to extract meaningful insights from large and complex data sets. You will also be responsible for supporting the teams with data operational tasks.

Please note this is a hands-on role, involving a lot of data crunching: if you are looking for a management or supervisory position, this is not for you, as we strive to keep a flat hierarchy with very productive and operational teams.

Main Responsibilities


Design, develop, and deploy data-driven solutions to answer a variety of business problems (predictive maintenance, equipment lifecycle analysis, etc.)
Understand the requirements of product owners and provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
Work on the development of data models, algorithms, and statistical analyses to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets.
Design and implement data pipelines and data warehouses to support data analysis and reporting needs.
Develop and maintain dashboards and visualizations to communicate insights and findings to stakeholders.
Mentor and coach developers on best practices in data analysis, modelling, and visualization.
Keep up to date with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies, and apply them to solve business problems.


Your Education And Languages Capabilities


Bachelor in Computer Science or Data Science (Master or PHD a plus)
Full professional proficiency in English. French an asset.


Your technical Knowledge


Advanced proficiency in programming languages (ideally Python), and experience with data manipulation and analysis libraries such as Pandas and NumPy.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques such as regression, classification, and deep learning.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau/Power BI, or standard libraries (D3/Plotly/...).
Strong communication skills and ability to communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.


Preferred Qualifications


At least 3 years in a similar role
Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Hive (experience with Databricks is a big plus).
Experience with cloud technologies (ideally Microsoft Azure).
Experience with Agile/Scrum disciplines based on Azure DevOps


Your personal attributes


A true believer in the value of data, with the ability to take ownership and deliver autonomously and proactively tangible results to the organization.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders, including very senior managers.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to identify patterns and insights in large data sets.
Strong attention to detail and ability to ensure data accuracy and completeness, while keeping solutions as simple and robust as possible.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work in an agile environment, including the ability to manage priorities and give regular reporting on ongoing tasks.
Continuous learning mindset, keeping up to date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning.
Ability to think creatively to develop innovative solutions to complex business problems.


For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.

BOBST is one of the world‚Äôs leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let‚Äôs shape the future of the packaging world.

The production site of Mex, near Lausanne in Switzerland, is also the headquarters of the Bobst Group. It is the most important site, employing approx. 1500 passionate people.

It also trains each year roughly 200 apprentices. The site offers an idyllic work environment. In the countryside and close to major highways, it is also well served by public transport. It offers many amenities, such as a corporate restaurant, sports fields, a fitness and a nursery. The facilities have been recently renovated and represent a model for sustainable development.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

VF Corporation is looking for an exceptional Business Intelligence Analyst to join our BI EMEA team based in Stabio, Switzerland.

Let's talk about the role!

As a BI Analyst, you have been already exposed to the BI subject matter, either at the University or in a first work experience. You will participate in the design and deployment of key strategic BI Solutions. You will support your Lead Manager in daily activities to ensure product adoption and contribute to the verification and continuous improvement of reporting data quality. Direct exposure to the end-user community is crucial in this role, as is an advanced ability to conceptualize and test solutions from source system to BI solutions.

Job Details

We expect you to deliver unbeatable results while fulfilling the following aspects of the BI Analyst role:


Gather and understand Business Requirements
Transform Business Requirements into Logical Data Models and high-level Technical Requirements
Communicate the gathered information with the technical team
Implement reports as a Superuser
Manage incidents and provide support to the Business Community in addressing their data/tools challenges


Skills For Success

To succeed as a BI Analyst, you must translate our business objectives into a coherent BI design, follow up with the implementation team, double-check the final deliverables, and follow-up their adoption in the Business Community. Strong empathy and influencing skills will help you get both the business and the technical team on board. We are looking for someone with a service-oriented approach who has:

Hands-on experience in data investigations

Teamwork attitude, good interaction, and communication skills

Focus on the end-user community
Problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Analytical mindset
Ability to escalate to the appropriate level of support
Efficiency and effectiveness in dealing with end-users
Fluency in spoken and written English

VF Corporation is looking for an exceptional Business Intelligence Analyst to join our BI EMEA team based in Stabio, Switzerland.

Let's talk about the role!

As a BI Analyst, you have been already exposed to the BI subject matter, either at the University or in a first work experience. You will participate in the design and deployment of key strategic BI Solutions. You will support your Lead Manager in daily activities to ensure product adoption and contribute to the verification and continuous improvement of reporting data quality. Direct exposure to the end-user community is crucial in this role, as is an advanced ability to conceptualize and test solutions from source system to BI solutions.

Job Details

We expect you to deliver unbeatable results while fulfilling the following aspects of the BI Analyst role:

  • Gather and understand Business Requirements
  • Transform Business Requirements into Logical Data Models and high-level Technical Requirements
  • Communicate the gathered information with the technical team
  • Implement reports as a Superuser
  • Manage incidents and provide support to the Business Community in addressing their data/tools challenges

Skills For Success

To succeed as a BI Analyst, you must translate our business objectives into a coherent BI design, follow up with the implementation team, double-check the final deliverables, and follow-up their adoption in the Business Community. Strong empathy and influencing skills will help you get both the business and the technical team on board. We are looking for someone with a service-oriented approach who has:

  • An attitude of teamwork, aiding colleagues in resolving issues, and hastening your own learning curve about the technical landscape and business processes

  • Exposure to Fashion/Retail industries in prior experiences is considered a plus

Other Key Skills For Success

Title: Trainee in Data Analytics (80-100%)
Description:

Zu Deinen Aufgaben geh√∂ren unter anderem der Unterhalt von existierenden Datenbanken, Reports und Dashboards. Des Weiteren steht die Entwicklung von neuen Analysen entlang der Business Anforderungen im Fokus. Bei Canon f√∂rdern wir die M√∂glichkeiten, Neues auszuprobieren, die eigene Perspektive einzubringen und im Team Wissen offen auszutauschen. Deshalb suchen wir Menschen, die ihr eigenes Drehbuch schreiben und ¬´die Regie in ihrem Leben √ºbernehmen¬ª.

In Deinem Traineeship bewegst Du Dich zudem in einem inspirierenden Umfeld, in dem Du den Raum hast, Dich zu entwickeln und Deine Geschichte weiterzuschreiben. Du konzentrierst Dich dabei auf die finanz- und betriebswirtschaftlichen Auswertungen sowie die dahinterliegenden Daten. Du unterst√ºtzt das BI/Controlling-Team in der Datenaufbereitung- und Analyse (Sales Forecasts, Auftragsbestand, Durchlaufzeiten, ad hoc Reports), und arbeitest eng mit dem Business zusammen.

Nebst einem wertsch√§tzenden und tollen Team bieten wir Dir folgende Benefits


Flexibles Arbeiten Home Office, & Jahresarbeitszeit
Work Life Balance mind. 25 Tage Ferien & frei am eigenen Geburtstag, 40h Woche mit Kompensationsm√∂glichkeit, unbezahlter Urlaub & Ferienkauf, Corporate Volunteering Tag
Sonstige Benefits wie √ºberobligatorische Sozialversicherungsleistungen, erweiterte Elternzeit, Zugang zur Online-Lernplattform, internes Care Management‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¶ & noch vieles mehr, was wir gerne im Gespr√§ch erz√§hlen.


Wen wir suchen

Als motivierte Pers√∂nlichkeit verbindest Du Dein analytisches und vernetztes Denken mit einer Portion Neugier und Eigeninitiative. Du bist bereit, Neues zu lernen und auch Verantwortung zu √ºbernehmen, um etwas bewegen und gestalten zu k√∂nnen. Deine guten Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten helfen Dir dabei, Dich zielgruppengerecht auszudr√ºcken.

Qualifikationen & Kompetenzen


Hochschulabschluss (Bachelor/Master) in Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Data Science oder vergleichbare qualifizierte Ausbildung
Erste Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Stelle von Vorteil
Kenntnisse im Aufbau und Unterhalt von Datenbanken (SQL, Access) und Dashboards (PowerBI, o.√§.) sind ein Muss
Gute Kenntnisse in Excel und mit der Microsoft-Umgebung sind erw√ºnscht, Erfahrungen in der Oracle-Umgebung (R12, OAS, DV) oder mit Salesforce.com ein Plus
Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse (in Wort und Schrift), Franz√∂sisch von Vorteil


Weitere Informationen

Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt? Wir freuen uns, Dich bald kennenzulernen!

Ansprechperson

Sereina W√ºst

HR Business Partner

F√ºr diese Stelle ber√ºcksichtigen wir nur direkte Bewerbungen.

Auf dem Weg zu unseren Unternehmenszielen brauchen wir Menschen, die mit uns die Zukunft gestalten und die zu den Regisseuren einer sinnhaften Karriere werden wollen, indem wir ein Arbeitsumfeld bieten, das von einer starken Philosophie (Kyosei) getragen ist. Du unterst√ºtzt das BI/Controlling-Team in der Datenaufbereitung- und Analyse (Sales Forecasts, Auftragsbestand, Durchlaufzeiten, ad hoc Reports), und arbeitest eng mit dem Business zusammen.

Nebst einem wertsch√§tzenden und tollen Team bieten wir Dir folgende Benefits

  • Flexibles Arbeiten Home Office, & Jahresarbeitszeit
  • Work Life Balance mind. 25 Tage Ferien & frei am eigenen Geburtstag, 40h Woche mit Kompensationsm√∂glichkeit, unbezahlter Urlaub & Ferienkauf, Corporate Volunteering Tag
  • Sonstige Benefits wie √ºberobligatorische Sozialversicherungsleistungen, erweiterte Elternzeit, Zugang zur Online-Lernplattform, internes Care Management‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¶ & noch vieles mehr, was wir gerne im Gespr√§ch erz√§hlen.

Wen wir suchen

Als motivierte Pers√∂nlichkeit verbindest Du Dein analytisches und vernetztes Denken mit einer Portion Neugier und Eigeninitiative. Du bist bereit, Neues zu lernen und auch Verantwortung zu √ºbernehmen, um etwas bewegen und gestalten zu k√∂nnen. Deine guten Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten helfen Dir dabei, Dich zielgruppengerecht auszudr√ºcken.

Qualifikationen & Kompetenzen

  • Hochschulabschluss (Bachelor/Master) in Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Data Science oder vergleichbare qualifizierte Ausbildung
  • Erste Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Stelle von Vorteil
  • Kenntnisse im Aufbau und Unterhalt von Datenbanken (SQL, Access) und Dashboards (PowerBI, o.√§.) sind ein Muss
  • Gute Kenntnisse in Excel und mit der Microsoft-Umgebung sind erw√ºnscht, Erfahrungen in der Oracle-Umgebung (R12, OAS, DV) oder mit Salesforce.com ein Plus
  • Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse (in Wort und Schrift), Franz√∂sisch von Vorteil

Weitere Informationen

Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt? Wir freuen uns, Dich bald kennenzulernen!

Ansprechperson

Sereina W√ºst

HR Business Partner

F√ºr diese Stelle ber√ºcksichtigen wir nur direkte Bewerbungen.

Auf dem Weg zu unseren Unternehmenszielen brauchen wir Menschen, die mit uns die Zukunft gestalten und die zu den Regisseuren einer sinnhaften Karriere werden wollen, indem wir ein Arbeitsumfeld bieten, das von einer starken Philosophie (Kyosei) getragen ist. Jetzt ist es Zeit, gemeinsam Geschichte zu schreiben.Living and working together for the common good.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
üè≠ For our client specialized in manufacturing and pharmaceutical, we are looking for a data engineer to support them for a 6-month initiative.




üéØ Responsibilities

Developing a data product based on an existing prototype by extracting data from multiple sources to create data visualizations as output.
Creating automated extraction and loading processes from key databases.
Creating easy-to-maintain transformations using DBT.
Enabling a data storage solution and consumption by users via API or GUI.
Developing, maintaining, and documenting a solid codebase that we can turn into a self-service framework.
Work with data scientists to ensure data is correct for the visualization they will implement.

üíº Stack needed

Gitlab CI for CI pipelines and data pipelines
Python for data extraction scripts
SQL for data extraction from internal databases
DBT for data transformations
PostgreSQL for persistence of final product data

Title: Market Data Analyst (m/f/d) - 100%
Description:
Temporary contract of 12 months |Renowned organization located in Basel


About Our Client

Our client is an international organization in the financial industry with a strong presence in Basel.

Job Description

Operational Duties


Enhance governance processes and manage invoice reconciliation for market data services
Support accurate forecasting and procurement of market data resources


Business Analysis


Design and analyze market data processes, translating business needs into technical specifications
Collaborate with design teams on detailed system requirements


Project Involvement


Participate in projects, ensuring adherence to deliverables, timelines, and budgets
Contribute to market data optimization and governance initiatives


Change Management


Manage changes to market data systems in line with governance protocols


Communication


Maintain effective communication with market data teams and relevant business units


The Successful Applicant


Degree in economics, business administration, or finance
3 years of experience in market data operations within a banking environment
Experience with market data providers such as Bloomberg and Refinitiv, proficiency in Excel and SQL is of advantage
Strong communication skills and skilled in planning and conducting meetings independently
Knowledge of data management, regulatory requirements, and market data technologies (e.g. FIX)


What's on Offer


12 months contract
Renowned organization


Contact: Natalie Wochner

Quote job ref: JN-062024-6451148

Title: Competitive Intelligence Analyst I
Description:
If you need assistance during the recruiting process due to a disability, please reach out to our Recruiting Accommodations Team through the Accommodation Request form. This form is used only by individuals with disabilities who require assistance or adjustments in applying and interviewing for a job. This form is not for inquiring about a position or the status of an application.

Competitive Intelligence Analyst I

Are you a true team player looking to evolve in a fast-paced environment that aims at serving actionable insights to a broad set of stakeholders? Are you excited by the thought of working in an industry-leading competitive intelligence team, supporting all lines of business? Then this opportunity is for you!

Your curiosity, ambition and appetite for finding insights in competitor data will have a direct impact on many areas of the business and will translate directly into increased competitiveness and revenue opportunities for Expedia.

What You'll Do

Create information flows to support business execution


Drive data collection, scheduling and quality control to build and enrich datasets of competitive insights
Develop systems and processes to monitor price and supply competitiveness through data sourced from external vendors
Design workflows and define tests to ensure internal stakeholders leverage accurate and relevant data in an efficient manner
Fulfill ad-hoc requests for data and analysis


Solving the Problem and Communicating


Top-class eye for business, analytical rigor, combined with a problem solver mind-set and attention to detail
High level of intellectual curiosity and focus on willing to take action business insights
Excellent understanding of how to effectively visualize highly complex data.
Strong written and oral communication skills
Technically adept


Partner with internal group of customers to support them and understand their business needs


Establish trust and a collaborative working relationship
Provide high level of daily customer service as the team's primary liaison to a large (across many countries) group of customers within Expedia's lodging organization
Partner with internal data teams to identify and resolve data integrity issues


Who You Are


Bachelor's degree is required (MBA or other advanced degree is preferred) in a numerical field (Business, Economics, Statistics or Computer Science)
Any other qualification (e.g. program management) is a plus
Intermediate (or better) knowledge of SQL is required
Experience with a programming language (e.g. Python/R) highly recommended
Ability to convert raw data into impactful reports and insights
Knowledge of data visualization tools preferred (Tableau, Power BI etc.)


About Expedia Group

Expedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) powers travel for everyone, everywhere through our global platform. Driven by the core belief that travel is a force for good, we help people experience the world in new ways and build lasting connections. We provide industry-leading technology solutions to fuel partner growth and success, while facilitating memorable experiences for travelers. Expedia Group's family of brands includes: Brand Expedia¬Æ, Hotels.com¬Æ, Expedia¬Æ Partner Solutions, Vrbo¬Æ, trivago¬Æ, Orbitz¬Æ, Travelocity¬Æ, Hotwire¬Æ, Wotif¬Æ, ebookers¬Æ, CheapTickets¬Æ, Expedia Group‚Ñ¢ Media Solutions, Expedia Local Expert¬Æ, CarRentals.com‚Ñ¢, and Expedia Cruises‚Ñ¢.

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
What We Offer


Interact with our clients on regular basis to drive their business towards impactful change.
Work in multidisciplinary teams and learn from motivated colleagues.
A chance to take responsibility for your work, develop yourself every day and take full ownership of your career.
Become part of a fast growing international and diverse team.



What You Will Do


Perform data analysis in the field of customer and product analytics, marketing analytics, and (Gen)AI solutions.
Conduct analyses in typical analytical tools ranging from SAS, SPSS, Eviews, R, Python, SQL, Teradata, Hadoop, Access, Excel, etc.
Communicate analyses via compelling presentations.
Solve problems, disaggregate issues, develop hypotheses and develop actionable recommendations from data and analysis.
Prepare and facilitating workshops.
Manage stakeholders and communicating with executives.



What You‚Äôll Bring


Bachelor or Master (or Ph.D.) degree in a quantitative field with a focus on data analysis (e.g. econometrics, AI, mathematics, physics, and other exact sciences).
0-3 years of professional experience in the analytics domain.
Good knowledge of statistical concepts, accompanied by expertise with a set of analytical tools ranging from databases (e.g. SQL, BigQuery, noSQL) to programming languages (e.g. R, Python), and from data visualization (e.g. PowerBI) to machine learning and AI.
Understanding data engineering solutions is a plus.
Good knowledge of Git & Docker.
Professional fluency in English required with (Swiss) German as a strong plus.



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
VF Corporation is looking for an exceptional Business Intelligence Analyst to join our BI EMEA team based in Stabio, Switzerland.




Let‚Äôs talk about the role!

As a BI Analyst, you have been already exposed to the BI subject matter, either at the University or in a first work experience. You will participate in the design and deployment of key strategic BI Solutions. You will support your Lead Manager in daily activities to ensure product adoption and contribute to the verification and continuous improvement of reporting data quality. Direct exposure to the end-user community is crucial in this role, as is an advanced ability to conceptualize and test solutions from source system to BI solutions.




Job Details




We expect you to deliver unbeatable results while fulfilling the following aspects of the BI Analyst role:

Gather and understand Business Requirements
Transform Business Requirements into Logical Data Models and high-level Technical Requirements
Communicate the gathered information with the technical team
Implement reports as a Superuser
Manage incidents and provide support to the Business Community in addressing their data/tools challenges




Skills For Success

To succeed as a BI Analyst, you must translate our business objectives into a coherent BI design, follow up with the implementation team, double-check the final deliverables, and follow-up their adoption in the Business Community. Strong empathy and influencing skills will help you get both the business and the technical team on board. We are looking for someone with a service-oriented approach who has:




An attitude of teamwork, aiding colleagues in resolving issues, and hastening your own learning curve about the technical landscape and business processes
A general understanding of Business Intelligence/Data Warehouse applications
Understanding of Data Modeling principles
Hands-on experience in data investigations
Experience with Visual Insight platforms (Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, IBM Cognos preferred)
Experience with relational data access (SAP HANA, SQL Server, Redshift‚Ä¶)
Exposure to Fashion/Retail industries in prior experiences is considered a plus
Knowledge of the main SAP GUI, back-end tables, and their interactions is considered a plus




Other key skills for success:




Teamwork attitude, good interaction, and communication skills
Ability to handle Change Management
Focus on the end-user community
Problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Analytical mindset
Ability to escalate to the appropriate level of support
Efficiency and effectiveness in dealing with end-users
Fluency in spoken and written English




VF is a global apparel company connecting people to the lifestyles they cherish through our family of iconic brands. At the heart of our journey lies our purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It‚Äôs the reason we come to work every day. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Learn more at vfc.com




What‚Äôs In It For You

We‚Äôre in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That‚Äôs why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we‚Äôre the total package.




A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together
Be part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi brand, multi countries organization
On site gym offering health and well-being initiatives
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands
Break out areas offering complimentary hot drinks




This post is not eligible for relocation support.




Free to Be, Inclusion & Diversity

As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.




As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, VF is committed to support disadvantaged groups whilst providing equal opportunities for both VF associates and applicants alike.




If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

Title: Digital Data Analyst (f/m/d) 80-100%
Description:
Join us in the top league!

We are the largest private telecommunications company in Switzerland and a subsidiary of Liberty Global. With Switzerland‚Äôs leading gigabit fiber optic network and one of the world‚Äôs best mobile networks, we are headed right to the very top. Our goal is clear: To become the national champion, pioneering the market. Future-oriented ways of working and workplaces make us one of the most attractive employers on the Swiss market.

Make the most of your talent: Get to know Sunrise right here!

The Digital Analytics team is seeking a passionate digital (web and app) data analyst to take on a role with real impact, shaping both the projects we undertake and our approach to them. As an exceptional analyst and advisor, you will regularly interact with Squad Leads in Sunrise‚Äôs Digital Department. Utilizing your business acumen, web/app analytics expertise, and communication skills, you will identify and quantify opportunities for initiatives and report on their progress and success.

Tasks


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data analysis needs, define KPIs and monitor performance; Work as strategic data advisor providing actionable insights
Monitor website & app traffic and analyze user behavior using Google Analytics, BigQuery and Looker Studio; Create scalable visualizations and reporting solutions that are actionable and drive business decisions
Provide ad-hoc analysis to identify root causes, trends and patterns in data to inform decisions
Ensure the accuracy, completeness, and validity of onsite (web and app) data; work closely with tracking/implementation developers
Conduct A/B tests and experiments to improve users conversion rates and engagement
Build documentation and training to help stakeholders self-serve and up-skill on topics related to digital analytics


Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics; or equivalent practical experience
4+ years of experience in digital analytics, preferably with Google Analytics; Tag Management and tracking implementation experience a plus
Strong knowledge of SQL and previous experience with data visualization tools (e.g.: Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI)
Experience conducting A/B tests and experiments to improve website performance and user engagement
Excellent analytical and business skills to refine solutions jointly with stakeholders
Extraordinary motivation and ability to plan and deliver projects reliably in a fast-paced environment
Fluency in written and oral English


At Sunrise, you will work in a dynamic and international environment where every voice is heard, perspectives are shared, and values are respected. We are an equal opportunity employer, with a diverse workforce, which is part of the success of our business. Sunrise has partnered with ¬´Advance Gender Equality in Business¬ª, is a recipient of the Swiss LGBTI-Label and is certified with the ¬´Fair-ON-Pay Advanced¬ª for providing equal pay for work of equal value to women and men.

In addition to our new ¬´FlexWork¬ª working model, we offer you above-average social benefits and attractive product advantages from the Sunrise range.

Seize this opportunity to join us on our journey to actively help shape our future!

Information for agencies: Application dossiers sent or uploaded by placement agencies, or the like are not desired and will therefore not be considered and deleted.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Profil du candidat

Your Profile


You are graduated from of a quantitative Master or an engineering school with majors in



Mathematics, Physics, Data Engineering or Quantitative Finance.


Experience in large IT projects using continuous integration tools such as TFS or AWS is a plus. You have worked in python or C++ and enjoy programming.
Good knowledge in time series analysis, machine learning, statistical models and data science would be a plus.
Previous experience on a trading floor or in the commodities market would be a plus but for sure curiosity and interest for our industry is essential.
You have good communication skills, a can-do attitude and proactively take initiatives
You know how to work in an evolving environment where pressure and urgency are daily occurrences.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees‚Äô fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation.

Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We will provide necessary accommodations upon request.

Activit√©s

What You Will Do

Location: Geneva

Desired start date: Q2 2024

You will be part of the FIT team, a team of 8 members with a front status, sitting on the trading floor. The FIT team is responsible for the development and delivery of models and digital tools for the trading desks. It is the entry point for all trading desks, whether they are physical or paper and works closely with the market analysis and risk departments. We cover a wide range of topics and among those:


option pricing models. What is the value a physical pipe or a Time Charter vessel that enable us to arbitrage different indexes? Is there any relationship between flat price options and options on crack?
blend optimizations. How can I link my existing tanks, upcoming purchases and sells, available molecules in the market in a single tool that can show me the best potential blends that meet the regulatory requirements?
arbitrage calculations. How can I view simply and quickly the potential arbitrages ranging from 5-6 origin points to 5-6 destination points, while correctly considering freight costs, travel time and forwardness of the deal?
credit risk monitoring. What is the potential risk I am taking when trading derivatives instruments with counterparts with which there is no CSA agreement? How can I measure the return on risk I am taking with these counterparts?
stat arb tools. Are there any interesting links between pipe pressure in the US and Heating Oil market? Is there a tool where I can automatically execute some lots in the market instead of passing them manually?
data manipulation. Is there a one place stop shop or a tool where I can do some correlation or market analysis studies? How can I hedge specific illiquid indexes?



The tools provided by the team are used on a daily basis by the traders and are maintained by FIT. The mastery of our architecture, general interest in IT issues and dedication to client‚Äôs needs is necessary for a successful experience in the team. The FIT team works therefore regularly with the IDS department and has a dedicated IDS-FO team working in close partnership with them. The main infrastructure challenges in the coming year are the switch of our current applications to the group cloud and the construction of a robust Cloud Data Warehouse.

The programming languages you will be working on are Python, C++ or VBA and the tools delivered to traders range from Excel spreadsheets to heavy web applications depending on the user‚Äôs needs.

FIT members are usually young, enthusiasts and eager to learn. After a successful passage in the team, depending on your appetite and opportunities, you may move to a ‚Äúquant on desk‚Äù position (working even more closely with the traders) or take a more central position in the team (working on more long term projects with higher impact on our infrastructure).

The trading floor is a high pace, challenging environment, requiring agility, sharpness and rigour. Good communication, teamwork, multi-tasking are also essential skills.

Contexte et environnement

Take your first steps into a fulfilling career and join our Front Innovation Team as a quantitative analyst.

Are you looking to grow your career in the vibrant world of energy trading?

Do you have an engineering or quantitative finance background with good programming skills?

If yes, we would love to see your profile!

To support TotalEnergies‚Äôs ambitions, the Front Innovation Tools team (FIT) is looking to hire their next quantitative analyst.

Our Culture

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.
Show more
HTML:
Profil du candidat

Your Profile

  • You are graduated from of a quantitative Master or an engineering school with majors in


Mathematics, Physics, Data Engineering or Quantitative Finance.

  • Experience in large IT projects using continuous integration tools such as TFS or AWS is a plus. You have worked in python or C++ and enjoy programming.
  • Good knowledge in time series analysis, machine learning, statistical models and data science would be a plus.
  • Previous experience on a trading floor or in the commodities market would be a plus but for sure curiosity and interest for our industry is essential.
  • You have good communication skills, a can-do attitude and proactively take initiatives
  • You know how to work in an evolving environment where pressure and urgency are daily occurrences.


At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees‚Äô fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation.

Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We will provide necessary accommodations upon request.

Activit√©s

What You Will Do

Location: Geneva

Desired start date: Q2 2024

You will be part of the FIT team, a team of 8 members with a front status, sitting on the trading floor. The FIT team is responsible for the development and delivery of models and digital tools for the trading desks. It is the entry point for all trading desks, whether they are physical or paper and works closely with the market analysis and risk departments. We cover a wide range of topics and among those:

  • option pricing models. What is the value a physical pipe or a Time Charter vessel that enable us to arbitrage different indexes? Is there any relationship between flat price options and options on crack?
  • blend optimizations. How can I link my existing tanks, upcoming purchases and sells, available molecules in the market in a single tool that can show me the best potential blends that meet the regulatory requirements?
  • arbitrage calculations. How can I view simply and quickly the potential arbitrages ranging from 5-6 origin points to 5-6 destination points, while correctly considering freight costs, travel time and forwardness of the deal?
  • credit risk monitoring. What is the potential risk I am taking when trading derivatives instruments with counterparts with which there is no CSA agreement? How can I measure the return on risk I am taking with these counterparts?
  • stat arb tools. Are there any interesting links between pipe pressure in the US and Heating Oil market? Is there a tool where I can automatically execute some lots in the market instead of passing them manually?
  • data manipulation. Is there a one place stop shop or a tool where I can do some correlation or market analysis studies? How can I hedge specific illiquid indexes?


The tools provided by the team are used on a daily basis by the traders and are maintained by FIT. The mastery of our architecture, general interest in IT issues and dedication to client‚Äôs needs is necessary for a successful experience in the team. The FIT team works therefore regularly with the IDS department and has a dedicated IDS-FO team working in close partnership with them. The main infrastructure challenges in the coming year are the switch of our current applications to the group cloud and the construction of a robust Cloud Data Warehouse.

The programming languages you will be working on are Python, C++ or VBA and the tools delivered to traders range from Excel spreadsheets to heavy web applications depending on the user‚Äôs needs.

FIT members are usually young, enthusiasts and eager to learn. After a successful passage in the team, depending on your appetite and opportunities, you may move to a ‚Äúquant on desk‚Äù position (working even more closely with the traders) or take a more central position in the team (working on more long term projects with higher impact on our infrastructure).

The trading floor is a high pace, challenging environment, requiring agility, sharpness and rigour. Good communication, teamwork, multi-tasking are also essential skills.

Contexte et environnement

Take your first steps into a fulfilling career and join our Front Innovation Team as a quantitative analyst.

Are you looking to grow your career in the vibrant world of energy trading?

Do you have an engineering or quantitative finance background with good programming skills?

If yes, we would love to see your profile!

Our Culture

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Title: Data Engineer / ro-909
Description:
For our customer located in Basel/Switzerland we are currently looking for a: Data Engineer (m/f/d)

The perfect candidate has 4 years of experience in data and workflow engineering. Additionally, the person is experienced in data integration using warehouses, data lakes and database modeling. Experience with Python and SQL is required. Lastly, the candidate communicates fluently in English.

General Information:

‚Ä¢ Start date: 15.08.2024

‚Ä¢ latest Start Date: 01.11.2024

‚Ä¢ Planned duration: 6 months

‚Ä¢ Extension: possible

‚Ä¢ Workload: 100%

‚Ä¢ Remote/Home Office: partially remote, partially in Basel




Tasks & Responsibilities

Developing a robust light-weight framework for creating data products based on an existing prototype that extracts data from multiple sources and creates data visualizations as the output
Creating automated extraction and loading processes from key databases
Creating easy-to-maintain transformations using DBT
Enabling a data storage solution and consumption by users via API or GUI
Developing, maintaining and documenting a solid codebase that we can turn into a self-service framework




Must Haves

Min. vocational training
3-6 years of experience in data and workflow engineering skills (ETL/ELT principles)
Experience with data integration using warehouses, data lakes and database modeling (Snowflake, Postgres etc.)
Experience with Python for data extraction scripts
Experience with SQL for data extraction from internal databases
Experience with PostgreSQL for persistence of final product data, AWS S3 as a staging layer, Gitlab for CI, task and code tracking
A passion for working in an environment with high urgency, and you love to spend most of your time writing code
Enjoying operational side of things, like managing cloud-based infrastructure, workflow orchestration (e.g. GitLab CI/CD) and containerization (e.g., Docker)
Interest in understanding biomedical or preclinical research data or have previously worked in a Pharma domain
Excellent communication skills in English




Nice to Haves

DBT for data transformations

Title: Market Data Analyst (m/f/d) - 100%
Description:
Temporary contract of 12 months |Renowned organization located in Basel


About Our Client

Our client is an international organization in the financial industry with a strong presence in Basel.

Job Description

Operational Duties


Enhance governance processes and manage invoice reconciliation for market data services
Support accurate forecasting and procurement of market data resources


Business Analysis


Design and analyze market data processes, translating business needs into technical specifications
Collaborate with design teams on detailed system requirements


Project Involvement


Participate in projects, ensuring adherence to deliverables, timelines, and budgets
Contribute to market data optimization and governance initiatives


Change Management


Manage changes to market data systems in line with governance protocols


Communication


Maintain effective communication with market data teams and relevant business units


The Successful Applicant


Degree in economics, business administration, or finance
3 years of experience in market data operations within a banking environment
Experience with market data providers such as Bloomberg and Refinitiv, proficiency in Excel and SQL is of advantage
Strong communication skills and skilled in planning and conducting meetings independently
Knowledge of data management, regulatory requirements, and market data technologies (e.g. FIX)


What's on Offer


12 months contract
Renowned organization


Contact: Natalie Wochner

Quote job ref: JN-062024-6451148
